description:
**********DISCLAIMERS**********

I'm giving this 5 stars because we personally had a great experience, but I want to be clear that there are some serious disclaimers. I've read a lot of the other reviews and there seem to be some ethical discrepancies in terms of skewed reviews. I'm not sure if they're true (I wasn't aware of the 15% discount thing until I read the Yelp reviews), or if the restaurant is responsible for the hacked account. Maybe they've also gotten better, but I would definitely advise you to be cautious anyway and maybe pay with cash to be extra careful. If it happens to be true that someone's account was hacked/a 15% discount is given to 5 star reviews, please please to the restaurant: you don't need bribery or sketchy business practices to support you. You have an adorable shop with great food and good service. You can be a 5 star place on Yelp on your own merits!

**********ACTUAL REVIEW**********

Now, for our experience: the food came fast! This place is super cute on the inside and they play good, chill music. We got the tiramisu, strawberry shortcake mini toast, and the s'mores half-waffle. The s'mores waffle had nutella on it and it was exactly what you'd want it to be (absolutely delicious with big fluffy marshmallows). The toast tasted like toast and jam at breakfast only 100x better! The tiramisu had a good texture and was enjoyable. It wasn't the best tiramisu ever, but that's okay because this isn't an Italian restaurant. I also had the rose latte which was pretty good, and very foamy (definitely instagrammable).
author: Claire C.

description:
Came back here after many years later, desserts are bomb as usual but service omg.....


Me and some friends order the coconut sogo dessert, 3 of them and some chicken wings.

10-20 mins later the wings come waits 10-15 mins no sago waits another 5 mins still nothing. We ask the girl server where is our sago and she said "oh so sorry thought you only wanted the chicken wings" then wait another 10 mins or so then the sago comes 2 of them instead of 3 we tell the server "umm we ordered 3 not 2" she reply's "omg so sorry I thought 2" then 5 mins later it comes.

Long story short she messed up our order Twice like what the F...... maybe if you stop focusing on taking selfies on your phone or whatever you were doing then you wouldn't have forgot our order.... 

Want to give this place higher rating for the good food but horrible service, one of the worst experience ever anywhere....
author: Christopher G.

description:
A picture is NOT worth a thousand words when food is the topic

At the midsummer's night hangout, my cousins and I found a parking spot (for free) right in front of the restaurant (lucky us!). We walked into the restaurant excited about the dessert that I spare a portion of our stomach for after a big dinner. The shop was rather small and snuggle, with barely any space to stand. That was okay, because another group of 3-4 people waited outside in the cold, while we did not. 

We ordered the hot tofu, to warm up our happy heart. The waitress said we needed to wait 15 minutes because the dish ran out. We agreed to wait while signing up on the waitlist and stepped outside into our car to wait. The next wait did not go long; she called us in within 3 minutes. 

Although one thing I personally rather pissed about didn't come from the service itself but the etiquette of the customers. Many tables finished and paid, however, they superglued their butt onto the seats and didn't leave, while others waited for their turn to eat. Like I said, the shop is little so after you eat and enjoy your food, leave and let others enjoy theirs too. Don't stay in your selfish shell and ignore others' suffers. 

My mom makes delicious soft tahu (tofu) and I like to compare those I bought to hers. To my expectation, anything I bought is worse than my mom's. There isn't ginger nor caramelized syrup. This soft tofu consists of solely tofu and nothing else. For $5, I bet they profited about $4 from it. I think another reason why it costs so much for so little is the cute container it comes in (which I cannot take with me). Deceiving the eyes, any pictures here, that does not compare the container to their hand, makes the the portion looks huge like around 6-7 inches. It's smaller than a bowl, I'm telling you. I didn't order their toast because it was cold but I thought they looked pretty tasty. Anyway, I may come back to try something else but the tofu.
author: Trinny T.

description: What the hell, came here only to discover that it's not open like Yelp said it was!! I guess business hasn't been good so they altered their hours -- doesn't open until 6pm!!
author: Cathrin P C.

description:
Came here at 8pm on a Friday night (prime hang out time) to wait for our iPot reservation LOL, and were seated immediately... probably because we were the only ones in the restaurant lol.

The GOOD:
+ A lot of seating. 
+ Fair prices (3.95 - 6.95 for an average dessert)
+ The place was fairly clean. And if you like seeing pink Paris/Eiffel tower pictures and decor everywhere, this is the spot for you lol.

The MEH:
- even with no one in the restaurant, we were served and attended to quite slowly. The server/cashier was never in sight, and it took a while to call the server for our check and ketchup, or anything else.
- the desserts lacked any wow factor. Usually i'm really excited to have dessert and taiwanese places like these usually do something extra to make a statement or make it look cute/ extra appetizing, but it was quite plain here. Please refer to the pictures. 
- Decorations were too pink and PARIS-ey for my tastes. It's like they wanted it to seem a bit boujie-er, but didn't have the good looking desserts to back it up.
- There's a $3/person requirement, which the waiter didn't tell us about until we asked for the check.
author: Vy T.

description:
There are quite a few pearl tea joints around this area, but this place is good if 1.) you want a place to sit and chat and 2.) you are hanging out with people who don't like boba (AKA blasphemers). The menu us quite extensive and has both sweet and savory options, so chances are you'll find something for every tastebud.

Rating Breakdown:
1/2 Stars for Taste --
The desserts here aren't anything to write home about, but they're decent. My favorite is the hot almond soup with black rice -- the perfect dessert on a cold day if you don't want something too sweet. The brick toast is also good, though I've only tried the mango pyramid toast. It's cubes of thick toast, buttered and griddled so it's crisp on the outside, warm and soft on the inside, then generously slathered in sweet cream and syrup then topped with a scoop of ice cream. Sweetness overload for those cheat days. 

0.5/1 Stars for Value --
The drinks and desserts are slightly overpriced but that's understandable considering it's a sit-down establishment. Most milk teas will probably run you around $5 and a brick toast will be closer to $10. Also, they charge $.30 to use a credit card.

0.5/1 Stars for Customer Service --
This place gets kind of busy and it's usually run by only one or two people at a time. Sometimes it's hard to get the server's attention, but generally the food comes quick. 

Bonus star because this is my go-to place after dinner when friends are visiting and we want to find somewhere to sit and catch up.
author: Abby W.

description:
Went here with a few friends for dessert after dinner. I would have to say it wasn't worth the 4 stars they show on yelp to me.
#1 I don't like when businesses will give you 15% off your bill if you give them a 5 review.
I feel that if you want a good review you should do a good job. Therefore just because I am giving them only 1.
#2 the desserts were just ok and over priced. Most dessert places are overpriced for what they are but I guess that is the name of the game
author: Austin C.

description:
Came here and got the matcha honey toast mango black sticky rice.

First time I had honey toast, it takes 15 min but it's worth it! Was pleasant surprised as the inside had really crunchy bread. A little sweet and when you bite into it, the bread just shatters (in a good way) the rest of the toppings are all whatever, but the inside and the toast itself really stood out. The cold and liquid toppings with the crunchy toast was a great balance.

The hot mango black sticky rice dessert was good. Mango was really tasty, just wish the sauce had more condensed milk in it.

I wasn't a fan of the decor as it seemed like it was trying to be too cute.

The novelty of the honey toast might wear off on me, but until then this is 4 stars.
author: Victor D.

description:
Good and friendly service staff! I got the matcha green tea ice cream and red bean Belgian waffle and it was decent! The presentation is very well done for sure, but quality and taste of the desserts were debatable. I went at 4 pm on a Sunday afternoon and there were 2-3 other tables seated too. Matcha green tea ice cream wasn't very sweet and the waffle was definitely not a Belgian waffle which was quite disappointing... 

Small area, a little dirty and the facilities probably needs a facelift. However, their menu is very expansive so there's a ton to choose from! Cute place to go on a date and go Chinese grocery shopping later
author: Leslie T.

description: Everything else was closed except this spot when I walked by after 12AM. I wanted something savory, so I got the spaghetti with meat sauce and the bacon wrapped sausage. The sausage is hot dogs. The spaghetti was not the best I have ever had. But it satisfied my hunger. I had this place bookmarked.
author: Denise C.

description:
*************I NEVER WROTE THIS REVIEW************

Can someone explain to me how you used my account a review for this place?!?

I've never even been to SF.*****************

Creepy, and says a lot of the quality of your stuff. 

***********
author: Dana A.

description:
Honestly, I found ETC to be nothing special. Sure, the walls are candy pink and they have popular Taiwanese/Hong Kongese snacks and desserts like brick toast and popcorn chicken, but eh. It's a tiny joint that feels stuffy (especially with the way the owner/host stares at every table while they eat from the back) with some shady policies.

If there's a table when you get there, they sit you down and hand you your menus and a pitcher of water right away. A couple that got there right after we did were asked to wait, and the host shuttled them into a sterile white hallway to the side of the main dining room and closed the door on them. Um, sketchy much?

We split the mini macaron chocolate brick toast, partially because my boyfriend insisted he could not fit any more food in him after Tasty Pot, and partially because I couldn't justify paying over ten dollars for a couple slices of toast and a scoop of ice cream. The two macarons that adorned the top (chocolate and matcha, I think) were soft and perfectly bite-sized, and the scoop of chocolate ice cream was delicious. The toast just didn't stand out, even with the addition of fresh strawberries. So continues the hunt for a good brick toast in the city.

At the table, a small menu stand indicates that if you check in and leave them a 5 star review, you can get 15% off your bill or a future bill. That's against Yelp policy, last I checked. We realized as we were eating that it would have been cheaper to build the same brick toast, and add some condensed milk or whip cream for about the same cost. I doubt it's a good value for what you're paying, and I think the only people who'd really enjoy it are the ones who don't mind someone staring at them intensely while they eat a waffle..
author: Gwen W.

description: I had the boba milk tea and coconut milk with sago and both were excellent.  Service was fine.
author: Joseph A.

description:
WARNING: REVIEWS ARE MOST LIKELY SKEWED!!!

ETC offers a 15% discount off your bill if you give them a 5 star review. That is most likely the reason for their high rating. I, however, shall not be bribed.

Came here as this was the only place with available seating for dessert. It's new so still fairly empty. Place was clean and they offer a free dessert with Yelp check in. What you get is dependent on how much you spend. We spent at least $20, meaning we could get a free tiramisu. Wish we hadn't. It was store bought, freezer burned crap. Took one bite full of ice crystals and slop and pushed it aside. 

Ordered mango sago, almond sago, sweet tofu (tofu fa), and strawberry honey toast. Sago seem to be standard. Honey toast could have been sweeter with more honey. Not the best, but edible. The sweet tofu wasn't very sweet, even with extra syrup. They put way too much ginger in the syrup, so I didn't enjoy it.

If you're craving Asian dessert and everywhere else is full, this is a good last stop. But wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Mallory L.

description: Seems like they have changed the dessert chef or some of the standards have decreased. It's been awhile since my last visit and unfortunately the desserts have declined in taste and quality. I ordered a mango shaved ice and it was shaved ice in name only. The shaved iced was little chunks of ice particles that I found myself chewing and hurting my jaw. It wasn't smooth or a nice fine texture as it should be. The mango ice cream had ice crystals in it, a sign of ice cream not at its peak of freshness. Overall a big thumbs down. The place is warm and relaxing, and the service was friendly, so I will give 2 stars. The dessert took some time to make, which is another negative. I remember when this place was packed; now I see why it was easy to get a table.
author: Dom L.

description:
This has to be my favorite place for brick toasts in the city.. 
They have a huge menu with a lot of different Hong Kong styled desserts (sago, waffles, sweet dumplings). I was surprised to see that they offer a variety of pasta dishes which looked good! Might have to try next time. :)
author: Leilani Y.

description:
The inside of this place is so adorable almost everything is pink even the walls. One thing I thought was weird is they were playing Rap music, although I was ok with music I feel it didn't fit the ambiance.

Dessert- mango sago 5/10 you can tell the mangoes they blended were soggy and getting ready to expire. 
Also got a taste of the green tea mountain bread thing( forgot the name lol) 7/10. The bread soaked in honey was soooo goood! I would recommend this dessert. 

Some tips I have for this place are: 
Change the music to something more calm lol.
Put ice in your water... it's too warm. Thanks
author: Camille B.

description:
Wanted to take my mom out to desserts but wanted to try a new place rather than always being boring and going to our usual. We were seated right away as there was no one there. 

Takoyaki was def just reheated frozen ones that they charge $1.25 for each. Pretty sad as I can get some fresh ones at the Torrance Mitsuwa for like $5. 

The sugar for the sweet tofu ain't even melted ginger sugar but rather some brown sugar they drop off at your table and I guess they only have the one cuz the girl had to come take it from us to give to the table next to us. The sweet tofu wasn't bad tho, it was pretty good. Out of everything we ordered, I think that was my fave. 

The mini strawberry toast was sad and pathetic looking, no one was impressed.

Fondue was alright but the fruits sucked, they gave us canned pineapples. My brother really liked it tho. He thought it was fun. 

Majority of their desserts aren't even homemade, they're store bought and prices are jacked up. They literally skimp and shortcut their way here & then charge a lot for it. Definetely will not be back, I think we will be going back to our usual.

P.S they prob have such hight rating on Yelp because they were offering 15% if you gave them a 5 star review, so people were prob just saying stuff to get that discount. Yelp has caught them on that.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Every time I'm in Hawaii, somebody wants to go to Shokudo for honey toast. The honey toast here beats it by a mile.

The service is alright, nothing amazing, nothing terrible. It's the desserts that I'm more excited about! There are so many options and most of the items I've had here are enough for two people, especially after dinner.

It can get pretty crowded here sometimes, but so far I've only ever been when it's empty.

Food: 8/10
Staff: 6/10
Atmosphere: 8/10
Value: 8/10
Overall: 7.5/10
author: Evan K.

description:
I wanted dessert one night. My brother and cousin didn't want to go to Golden Island or our usual place in San Mateo so a quick Yelp search led us here. 

The inside is a decent size. The decor is super decked out in pink and it's all cutesy like and weird, but we stayed anyway for the dessert and we were able to hit 2 pokestops from the inside so... it was cool. Service wasn't much to brag about. It was one dude working the whole time and while it wasn't his fault, the food came out really slow. I had gotten an order of their fries, s'mores honey bread, and my cousin had gotten one of their waffles with fruits. Prices are okay for what you get, but the wait was ridiculous.

Fries came out piping hot, but somewhat salty. I did enjoy the s'mores honey bread as it was gooey and chocolatey. I think my cousin enjoyed her waffle. Also, really sad- we saw an old guy order a pasta to eat and when he asked for pepper, the worker gave him a container of what looked like it was filled with air. When he tried to shake some to put on his pasta, it looked like dust came out. It was very sad. How do you guys run out of black pepper?!

Overall, come back? ... Not really. The service was slow and they require each person in the party to order something which doesn't always work out.
author: Venus L.

description: Great desserts and open super late. I really enjoyed my tiramisu honey toast. It was so delicious and perfect. The other snacks here are also enjoyable. mmm I want to come back to try more!
author: Jenn T.

description:
Another one on my list of favorite dessert cafe's!

This particular cafe is more intimate and cozy inside. It kind of gives me a homey feeling actually, every time I eat there. I have tried several of their desserts before but what really stood out was their creme brûlée! I usually love it here, but from time to time, there has been incidents where the texture of it was inconsistent so I have had to send it back. :( Other than those incidents, it is actually delish.

Food wise, I have only tried their pastas and their condensed milk with peanut butter sandwich. Both of which I have thoroughly enjoyed! I would definitely recommend this place to try since they are also open late night as well! 

There are several poke stops nearby within reaching distance too, for those who play ;)
They take both card (charged with small fee), and cash!
author: Sunia L.

description: Most desserts are expensive than other dessert places ! ETC Dessert cafe also charge tea fee when u just get in and sit down !
author: Bing L.

description:
Walking into ETC Dessert Cafe, I was immediately struck by the cuteness of the cafe's decor. It is the perfect setting for a tea party or hanging out with friends and catching up over an enormous serving of sago with mixed fruits. The latter is what my friends and I did. 

There is a wide selection of desserts. Can't make a decision? Look for the items with a star to help you pick a popular dessert. This is exactly what we all did after 10 minutes or so of indecisiveness. We ordered the warm tofu pudding (served with brown sugar on the side), mixed fruit with mango sago, and something with mixed fruit, grass jelly, and red bean. The last two items I listed can definitely be shared between two people since the portions are huge. We were please with our orders. 

We were one of three parties in the cafe late Sunday night. We were seated and served quickly. The cafe is great for groups.
author: Katie C.

description:
I like the pink color interior and the toast. Great for a late night dessert!
Get the toast with ice cream and mango sago.
author: Andrea T.

description:
This cafe looks like Hello Kitty threw up with an explosion of pink and cuteness when you first enter.   The cafe is kind of small, kind of close seating and doesn't have a cozy feel to it. Typical Chinese-like cafe, especially with the Chinese songs playing in the background. The waitress was quick and efficient. Their menu is full of dessert choices ranging from hot to cold. They also have free wifi.

So, the 3 star isn't for the environment, but for the food. I ordered a green tea shaved ice that came with 1 scoop green tea ice cream, 1 scoop vanilla, red bean, a couple of strawberries and what I assume are small green tea mochi. This was the most mediocre tasting green tea shaved ice I've ever eaten. I'm not sure what it is. The presentation looks great. The mochi was hard and difficult to chew due to the coldness of the ice. The red bean kind of tasted like it was just there. The ice cream was fine. The strawberries looked good, but were sour. Somehow, everything didn't really taste like it meshed together well. 

I probably won't be ordering green tea shaved ice again.
author: Tabitha H.

description:
Store front is a little hard to spot, I actually walked past here many times without knowing its existence! 

Marshmallow waffle- Presentation is great, waffle is ok but not amazing. Marshmallow is really soft but sticky, almost glue my upper and lower teeth together, and I personally think the marshmallow did not match very well with the waffle. 

mini brick toast with coffee ice cream- The brick toast is really fresh and the contrast of temperature and crunchiness from toast and softness from ice cream is amazing! 

mango sago with grapefruit- It's ok.The base taste milky and the texture is creamy, but not enough mango flavor, 

Really cute interior, lots of pink. I would say the tables are at an awkward height (too high) compared to the seats, making it hard to eat. Food is average but it is a great place to catch up with friends or have a date!
author: Karen C.

description:
First of all, the reviews on this place may be heavily skewed towards 5 stars because they bribe you with a 15% discount for a 5- star review. I don't take kindly to bribes, but I'll take your discount anyway! 
Secondly, this place offers you a free snack for purchasing up to a certain meal. We paid more than $20 so we got a free tiramisu. I always enjoy free perks! However, the tiramisu was a bit disappointing cause there were ice crystals in the cream so it was improperly refrigerated. 
Finally to the reviews: our table ordered 2 honey toasts, 1 mango tofu-fa, 1 almond paste sago. 
The almond paste sago was pretty good. No better, but no worse than any other sago from other dessert places. 
The mango tofu-fa was decent, but the mango didn't taste very sweet. 
The 2 honey toasts were OK. Far from spectacular, but it is satisfactory. I've definitely had better honey toast elsewhere, but ETC is local so there are pros and cons. I do suggest getting a regular honey toast and splitting it with a friend rather than getting a mini so you can get more bang for your buck.
Conclusion: nothing stood out to me to make me come back here again, but I might come out of convenience if I'm not willing to go to Richmond for honey toast. Also, the discount for a review seems super sketch and turns me off from the place.
author: Edmund L.

description:
Meh is all I can say. I would've given 4 stars originally but I would have to take off 1 star for the service lol. 

Came here tonight with my friend after work because we were craving sweets and were in the area. It wasn't busy at all but it did pick up a little after we started eating. 

Parking - not that bad...there is metered and residential parking. Probably will be a lot trickier on weekends. 

Service - not the best....it was my first time coming here so of course I had some questions about the menu. I didn't catch her name but one of waitresses was so rude and even rolled her eyes at me before she answered my questions. Now, I work in the restaurant business as well so I get that people may have one of those bad days but I was not even being difficult and I asked in the nicest way possible....She also messed up on my order and was really slow when it came to bringing our check. 

Food - 
1. Chocolate macaron party honey toast - my friend loved it. She was in chocolate heaven! 
2. Strawberry banana waffle - really good!! The fruits were fresh and the waffle was fluffy. I definitely approve! 
3. Fried chicken wings and fries - mediocre at best. Nothing special. Both were probably from the frozen section of Safeway or something. 

I would say definitely come here for the desserts but don't expect the service to be great or anything.....
author: Coco L.

description: Love their waffles, nice and crunch! Also shaved ice is one of my favorite, as well! Wish they open all day instead of nights only.
author: Jaylene L.

description:
I can describe this place as one of the string of dessert places open late in the avenues. I was captured by the pictures here on Yelp, that looked exquisitely amazingly. For dessert goers, this is a place for you, especially if you have a sweet tooth as big as mine. The ambience was slightly dim. I think they were trying to capture or match their menu to their walls, which was a little cute if I say so myself. Other than that, it took us a while to get service, about 15-20 minutes. I literally had to put my hands up and literally call him to get the servers attention. Once we finally got the service that we were asking for, we ordered their tea, mango pyramid toast, and their mango black sticky rice covered with coconut milk. 

Unfortunately, the pictures did not with stand the flavor of their desserts. Pictures here on Yelp were much better than the way the desserts tasted. First of all, the tea came out not hot at all. The mango black sticky rice with coconut milk had NO flavor (I don't know if it was suppose to be like that). I was slightly enlightened with the mango pyramid Toast, until I tasted the mango ice cream. I can clearly and definitely tell you, that is NOT mango ice cream. That was the most artificial mango tasting ice cream I have ever tasted! It was a bit depressing because it looked so pretty in pictures and once you tasted it, only the toasted tasted good. Not great, just good. 

Overall, I sadly have to only give this place a three star because of the wait and the taste. If the Toast had real good tasting mango ice cream with more mango pieces, I think I would've enjoyed it a little more. Will I go back to this place? I don't know, because it is one of the few dessert places open at 10 PM.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Lots of Asian desserts and drinks to pick from! Honey toast is my favorite!

Strawberry 
Matcha
author: Alyssa V.

description:
Very nice place to chill. 
Great variety of food choices. 
Not just desserts but also noodles / pastas.
author: Jackylyn C.

description: well... we wanted to try this place. they posted times of business on their door, but they weren't open at their designated time. we waited 15min minutes but no one came, and we didn't see anyone prepping or setting up inside. we'll just have to try this place another time. very unprofessional. maybe the opener has some of emergency or something..
author: Aiko H.

description:
Nice place for honey toast. 

Limited seating area. 

They charge 30 cents for credit card.

Slow service, seemed like there was only one gentleman working.

I ordered the tropical toast ..or whichever one that's filled with fruit lol 
Not bad, but I wouldn't spend $11 for dessert on a regular basis.
author: Danae L.

description: If you love pink things and Tigger, I've got JUST THE PLACE FOR YOU! The walk up to this place seemed pretty normal, but as soon as I turned around and my retinas were bombarded by the color pink.  I visited this pink establishment on a Wednesday night and was immediately seated.  We ordered the green tea ice cream pyramid toast.  It was very good; the toast cubes were perfect for absorbing the whipped cream mixed with green tea ice cream.  The presentation was great and was perfect for those who have to take a picture of every plate of food they devour. My only complaint was that the amount of ice cream for this massive pyramid was too small to accompany the cube toast.  Other than that, I would definitely come back to try other flavors and other items on the menu.
author: Alex J.

description:
Considering it was my first time here, and I had a major sweet-tooth at night...this was the nearest place suggested. 
As you walk in, it is pretty small with minimal amount of seats. I do like the cute decor with the pink walls and framed quotes hung up. You can choose where to sit. I liked how the water jug was complimentary and brought to your table. 
As far as what I ordered, which was the Matcha Red Bean Waffle, I loved it. I am glad my first try was a tasty one!! When ordering your waffles, you can either order Half or Full, price does vary depending on size. 
I've been told that this place is A-OK but to me, i thought it was great! Hopefully, as I do plan to come again, my expectations and hopes will not be lowered because I find this place to be tasty!! 
Definitely coming back with a friend or a group of gal-pals!
author: Stacey M.

description:
This place is great if you're in the area trying to get a late night dessert bite or some super tasty brick toast! 
I came here twice before and I ordered the same things as my last visit: brick toast, mango sago, and creme brûlée. 

The brick toast is an absolute MUST. It's super good, crispy, melts in your mouth too, has icecream on top and you can choose from different types of toppings and etc. The creme brûlée was also yum. 

My hot mango sago was also pretty good BUT when it arrived to the table, it had a hair in it (which is why I docked two stars down, cus that is just grossssss..)
I sent it back and got a new one and it was fine. 

Anyway,
The place itself is super cute. Decked out in plushies on shelves and pink walls, pink menus, cute atmosphere. 

Service is okay. Just okay. 

ETC also gives free tiny desserts if you check in, depending on how much you spend.  
Also there's 15% off if you give a 5 star review. So beware of the skewed ratings. 

Tl;dr The desserts are pretty good. Brick toast is the most worth it/must try if you o here. Cute atmosphere. Okay service.
author: Daisy S.

description:
I can never resist an Asian dessert cafe, especially when they serve honey toast!! We shared the tiramisu-coffee toast - warm, buttery, toasted white bread layered with creamy tiramisu and topped with coffee ice cream. If it could have had more of a fluffy, soft interior the balance would have been perfect, but it was delicious regardless. 

We also tried the mango tapioca dessert soup, a dessert that was new to me. It was lovely to have in a neighborhood that's consistently overcast. I enjoyed its warmth and homey essence, although it lacked some depth in flavor. Overall though, I got good feels from this place.
author: Hannah P.

description: I love this place!! Not only because their walls are pink and it's my favorite color but it's very good here! Reasonable pricing and the workers are very kind! Sucks they open at 2pm but the closing time makes up for it lol! Been here twice and each time I left very satisfied and actually craving more!! My favorite has to be their toast box! Not too sweet but just right for a sweet lover like me!
author: Lina T.

description:
Food tastes good, whats better is the service was great...
Got a table right away with a super warm welcoming, food/menu is very unique, fair and reasonable prices, and was prepared to serve us extraordinary fast!! Will definitely return, you too should come visit this spot!!

6 star if possible A+++
author: Mister S.

description: The smell, the charm, the desserts! Bring your friends, order a few of the toasts (mini size is a good portion) and enjoy the etc.....
author: James I.

description: Came back here two weeks ago and sad to say their menu got cut down and smaller. The portions you get are much smaller too! They used to have a lot of foods here but now it's mostly dessert and about 10 food dishes. This used to be my favorite dessert place but sad to say the service and quality has gone down significantly.
author: Ruby F.

description:
Yes to a place open late with desserts that's not in the Richmond area! 

I give it four stars for the fact they're open late and the desserts they carry. I used to live in the South Bay and brick toast was quite plentiful. In San Francisco, it's still taking its time to build roots. It was really yummy! I ordered the Tiramisu in regular, large enough for two to share. It wasn't overly sweet and textures were good, bread wasn't overly toasted. The piece of tiramisu that was on top was kind of disappointing. It didn't taste fresh or authentic. 

The other dessert I ordered was the tofu fa. It's prepared fresh so it takes some time to come out. It has a hint of coconut in it, which is so delicious!! It is served with brown sugar so the sweetness is adjustable to your taste! 

The service is average, no big deal. Be initiative to what you need and make it clear to servers what you want. 

Note: bathroom is a journey's away. I bet finding the wizard of oz was easier than finding this bathroom. You must leave the side door, climb stairs, turn left and go behind the wall (best way I can describe it). Bring your phone to be safe. Tad sketchy.... But workers are helpful and try to set you up for success :)

I'll be back again!
author: Tina Y.

description: Came here with my friend last Wednesday night. We walked in and there was no one inside lol. Parking was semi hard on irving bc they blocked off the meter parking for construction or something. But anyways the guy seated us, gave us menu and water. My friend and I ordered the green tea and red bean brick toast & chocolate fondue! Both pretty good. The dark chocolate fondue came in this heart shaped bowl which was romantic haha. It came with bunch of fruits, marshmallows, and 2 waffles. Overall pretty good experience!
author: Monica W.

description:
My friend and I finished eating dinner and she was craving for asian dessert. We found this place through Yelp and decided to check it out. It seems like ETC Dessert Cafe is popular for its brick toast, but we decided to try the Dessert Sampler instead. We were full from dinner, but not too full for dessert - Dessert Sampler it is!  

Our Dessert Sampler had fresh fruits, some sort of red bean jello dessert, tiramisu ice cream, and creme brûlée. My friend and I agreed that the tiramisu ice cream was our favorite. The other desserts were just okay - not bad, not spectacular. However, the presentation of the desserts was pleasing to the eye. The portion size was also good enough for two people to share.

The ambiance was cute and the place is a bit small. Walls were covered in pink and the cafe was playing "The Best Love Songs in the 90s". I was definitely jamming to M2M's "Pretty Boy" song.

I feel like I would only go here again if a friend wanted to check it out. Maybe I'll try one of the brick toasts next time, but there would be other dessert cafes I'd first recommend to a friend before this one.
author: Kristal D.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! The decor in this place is also very cutesy. This place mainly serves desserts but they also have a few non-dessert items.

Few tables inside but on a sunday evening around 6-7, there wasn't a lot of people. The waitress there was super nice. She was patient with us as she answered our many questions and gave recommendations. She was nice in giving us alternatives to things they sold out of.

The plating was beautiful. The dishes were delicious. I was in heaven. Most of what I had was very sweet so if you have a sweet tooth like me, you'll love this place. Otherwise, you might find it overly sweet.

I recommend the honey toast here. Bread was toasted to perfection. Had that nice crunch and wasn't burnt. All the fruits were fresh and nicely cut. If ever in the area, should totally stop by for dessert!
author: Benita M.

description: Pretty good! I feel like the market for Asian dessert spots open late at night is pretty saturated in the Bay Area so I wasn't expecting much. Ordered the mango tofu pudding (I asked for them to leave out the sago, they kindly complied.) Mango pieces and sauce was sweet and ripe, tofu pudding tasted fresh-clearly not to packaged kind. Yum! Price is average. Friend got the fruit tea which was also delicious. Service was fine.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Mmmhhhmmm the macaroons are great! The mini honey toast was just exquisite! The bread was very soothing and comforting. The almond paste tofu pudding was very sweet and melt in your mouth. It was smooth and silky. This place is perfect for an after dinner desert!
author: Doudou H.

description: My friend and I each had our own mini honey toasts and we were both very satisfied with our choices. The presentation was lovely and the toast itself was delicious. Sweet, creamy, a little crisp...oddly satisfying despite the nippy San Francisco weather. The service is decent; however, because it is a very small operation, the food did take a while to arrive. It was not a big deal though, the waitress didn't rush us to order or to leave...ETC Dessert Cafe is definitely a nice place to hang out and catch up with friends. Fair warning though, it is a little drafty inside....
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Came over on a weekend craving for honey toast. The good ones I had were in South Bay and I didn't want to drive down just for that. Sometimes I do, but not today. Not today.

I've been to ETC Dessert Cafe in 2012 and I haven't visit since then. Over all, I like the idea of mini size Honey Toast because that 1) solved my cravness, 2) good price for good amount for 2 people and 3) less guilty for getting all these in my stomach so I sort of skip the gym ;) The mini one doesn't look as good as the regular but hey, that's not the point.

I also ordered a mix fruit black tea, which was good and got these chopped fruits in my tea. The server was really nice although it was a slow night.
author: Leslie C.

description:
How does this place rated so well for 3.5 stars?
This place may look kind cute but....the Worst drink/dessert place ever. 

Our party ordered grass jelly milk tea, asked for half sweetness, came out still way too sweet. Couldn't taste the flavor of tea or milk. Very bad quality milk tea exact the kind you get for free when buying combo at some Chinese fast food restaurant.  

Taro coconut tapioca dessert (hot)
Tasted old and very watery. Feel like someone just mixed those ingredients prepared long ago and heated them together. We were joking it tasted like porridge. GROSS !

We had another two orders of similar hot desserts. All the same quality just slightly different ingredient. 

Total 4 orders came out around $18.5 which was way $$$ for such crappy low quality food. 

Service was whatever. 
Stay away!
author: Niki S.

description:
Wonderful place
My husband and I absolutely loved it! 
This was our first time to try food like this, tasted amazing!!!

Would def recommend and go back again!!!
author: Ovsick H.

description:
My first time trying out brick toast and my boyfriend took me here. I liked how there was pink everywhere and some seats had flat pillows on them (comfortable butt = happy butt). I forgot what exactly I ordered, but it had the green tea ice cream and fresh strawberries and was on the first page of the menu (no add ons, because I did not think that they were worth the extra cost). 

I liked how the water came inside corked glass bottles, but the forks were so flimsy and low quality that I was tempted to bend the prongs back and forth until they broke. The wait after ordering was about 15 minutes. The toast was buttered and warm and the whole dessert ranked 7/10 on my happiness meter. For not being very fulfilling (I shared it with another person), I would have liked to spend less than $12 on it.
author: Vy P.

description: Nice place to have dessert at. Tried the mini strawberry sweetheart brick toast, remind me of what I had back in HK. Would definitely come again. 10/10.
author: Lawson J.

description:
SUPER CUTE DESSERT CAFE!!!!

Felt like a little kid all over again while walking into this super asian establishment. Pink walls, cute white and black furniture, asian music videos, and a lot of yummy desserts to choose from. Their prices are very reasonable too! 

This place is pretty much like a restaurant for desserts. As soon as me and my friend sat down a waitress brought us glasses of water and handed us dessert menus. What made the place even better was that the waitress was super friendly. 

I ordered the waffle and fruit plate with Nutella on the side. So yummy! It had a perfect amount of vanilla ice cream on the side which made the dessert more desirable. 

This place is ideal for simply grabbing some well presented desserts with a friend or even on a date with your spouse, especially late night on a weekend since they're open until 1:30 am. 

There's something about little places like these that make me happy and feel like a kid inside :) Will definitely be back here more often when I'm craving yummy desserts for a cheap price and want to enjoy the cute ambiance.
author: Amanda R.

description: The best dessert in town. Try their famous Oreo banana split. I highly recommend it. Great food and dessert along Irving.
author: Ron M.

description: So cute here! Dessert tasted amazing! Small place, but cozy! Friendly service! All of our desserts looked fantastic and wasn't too sweet.
author: RACHELLE T.

description:
I have to say, I got excited because I saw on the menu they served hot tofu pudding which is super rare. I decided to order that and a honey lemon ice tea. 

I'm highly disappointed in my dessert and iced tea. For my tofu pudding, I was expecting to get a side of ginger syrup with my tofu since its bland and steamed. They gave me brown sugar which didn't taste right to me. I wished they listed what syrup/sauce they were going to use because I  basically wasted $3.75 on this since I didn't touch it because I didnt lole the sweetness of the brown sugar on my tofu pudding. It was suppose to be a soothing hot dessert to enjoy ):

Secondly, my honey lemon iced tea was the last to come out  of my party of 6. DONT ORDER IT. It tasted like watered down unsweetened tea with a couple of ice and three sizes of lemon. Highly disappointed since it costed me roughly $3.50-4 for it. 

The place wasn't super busy at all but service was so slow. Our waitress was nice but she wasn't attentive at all. The two stars is for her trying thought.
author: Valerie C.

description: First time coming here and first off I just want to say the service is great. The gentleman with the tattoos was very kind to us and had great manners. I would give 6 stars if I can because of the great service here.
author: Trinh M.

description: Hidden gem within the best neighborhood in San Francisco. Delicious deserts, and usually easy to get a table during busy nights. This spot is A1. Great food, staff and service! Highly recommend.
author: Alvin S.

description: Went around 9pm and it wasn't too crowded but the quality of the food isn't as good as I expected. There is definitely a bigger selection of desserts and the portion is pretty big but I wasn't as pleased as I thought I would be
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I finally tried this place! After always passing by it and deciding whether it was really worth it to come here for dessert. It was pretty empty when I went, granted it was a school night. The seats in the booth though, they provide great back and butt support, especially after you indulge yourself with bite after bite of sweet desserts. Also, if you order over $20 of food, you can get either their Belgium waffle with Nutella and marshmallow, or a mini banana split. I tried the watermelon sago, tiramisu honey toast, and their free Belgium waffle w/Nutella and marshmallow. 

Watermelon sago: you can't really go wrong with this. Sweet watermelon juice with a generous amount of sago at the bottom. Although I would recommend getting it with mixed fruit too because it tastes adds a lot more taste and texture.

Tiramisu honey toast: the presentation was actually pretty neat. They smeared "Etc" in chocolate on the edge of the plate, along with a honey toast topped with a scoop of ice cream, a slice of tiramisu cake, drizzled with chocolate. This dish is pretty sweet, so make sure you have a large sweet tooth before tackling on this dish. I only wish it was bigger, seeing as the smaller size cost $7.50. Other than that, no complaints about it. You can't really complain about warm honey toast with ice cream and whipped cream.

Belgium waffle w/Nutella and marshmallow: this was, by far, my favorite at this place. To you waffle lovers and you s'more lovers, strap on your seat belts and prepare for a wild ride. Combining these two was genius. If you thought Nutella on a waffle was good, get ready to add a toasted marshmallow on top, with a little whipped cream on the side. They cut them into small pieces so you can fit the whole piece in your mouth and get the whole Belgium waffle-s'mores taste. 

I'm glad I tried this place because it will be one of my regular asian dessert places from now on.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Irving Street is packed with Asian dessert places, but ETC Dessert Cafe is leagues above its neighbors. Not only does it have an awesomely weird name, it is open later than the competition, the service is very friendly, and the drinks and food are great. I enjoyed my smoothie and the Toast with Strawberry and Vanilla Ice Cream. 

Next time I'm craving some late-night dessert, I'm just going to skip the rest and head to the best: ETC Dessert Cafe.
author: Mark C.

description: Great place！ love the toast, we had the Banana and Oreo honey toast. The toast is very crispy and full of the taste of honey!
author: Rosa Z.

description: This is a tiny little place that you would miss it if you weren't specifically looking for it.  My daughter and I got fried calamari rings, mini tiramisu brick toast, teriyaki chicken ramen and iced fruit tea.  Everything was yummy.  We plan to go back again.
author: Aileen I.

description: We tried the teriyaki ramen and the oreo honey toast. The ramen was pretty basic, it looked like the packaged noodles. The broth had good flavor though. The honey toast was amazing! If I lived in San Francisco I'd be in here weekly. At first it's a weird flavor, but with each bite you get more and more addicted. Definitely a must try. Service was great too, she was super attentive.
author: Danielle G.

description: Awesome place to fulfill all your sugary cravings.  Make sure to get toasted marshmallow on the brick toast!
author: Lauren W.

description: I really like this place that dessert is really off the hook. For the amount that give you it is pretty cheap. Staff is very friendly and nice the food is worth it. I know it's a little teenybopper place where kids come and hang out and how did dessert and it's fine because it's probably what it's made for but I like this place to be a little more quiet a little more intimate to have a dessert or it could be loud but just not too loud where you can still hang out with your friends and have conversation and actually hear yourself but like I said the desert is totally worth it so I don't really care for the noise
author: Michele T.

description:
If you like green tea, try out their green tea pyramid toast! It is delicious!!! You can share it... or not. It's a cute little place, and it can get busy. 

I love this dessert place that's open late for my night cravings.
author: Windy O.

description: The brick toast is bomb.com. Nice pink bows on their menus. We had to wait a good 10-15 minutes but it wasn't too bad. We ordered the brick toast and mango shaved ice with ice cream. Definitely satisfied my sweets craving.  Will be back! EZ$
author: Garrett L.

description: Great service, we ordered the tiramisu coffee toast with caramelized banana. It's was great. It's the best toast I have ever had. The hot dessert like egg white almond paste was the best, cuz the sweetness just right. The ETC has super warm pink interior decorations, and a cute collection of tigger.
author: Cuiying H.

description:
I always come here for the toast. You may ask why? The size of the toast is just right. It's not overwhelming that you will get sick of it. It's nice of them to offer two size option, mini or regular which most places don't offer. I always order the mini. They have a bunch of flavors to choose from. So far ,the (mini Tiramisu toast) is my favorite. It has honey toast cubes, coffee flavor ice cream, 2 chocolate wafers, strawberries, chocolate syrup, Tiramisu cake and whipped cream. Sounds amazing doesn't it? It is amazing and its one of the must order items when you are here at ETC cafe.

My second favorite is : (Matcha Green Tea Moose Cake). I believe they just got this recently. I have to say is far my favorite Green tea cake , coming from a Matcha Green Tea Lover. The outside of the cake has a thin layer of jello like substance, the next layer is green tea moose, then its green tea sponge cake. The cake wasn't dry and wasn't bitter. It was just right. Then its filled with this cream. It has a nice scented flavor maybe it was the tea flavor , mixed with  red beans. The last layer was the green tea sponge. It was a very delightful sweet and moist cake. Each layer gives a new surprise for your mouth.
author: Miri L.

description:
The strawberry Brick toast was really good. Highly recommend!! 
Great customer service !
author: Kingston L.

description: My sister and I ate a lot. I wanted to try a couple of things and my sis just went along ;) gotta love big Sis when they help you eat dessert just so you can try a lot of things. This was my first time and my big sis's second and we both enjoyed somethings and disliked other things such as the Rose and honey toast but others should try it because we all have different tastes. But will definitely come back when I'm craving sweets and in the area.
author: G-Dragon Girl K.

description: Excellent dessert especially the jumbo honey bread toast with all the fixins..  the creme Brule was ab fab since it was light and not too sweet.
author: Matt K.

description:
The dessert here is neither amazing nor horrible, but they do have a large selection of HK style desserts and they usually come out looking pretty. If I'm feeling hungry I usually choose among the various honey toasts topped with fruit or ice cream, or the waffles topped with the same. They really do put some effort into making them look aesthetically pleasing, and the flavor isn't too bad. If I'm just thirsty I may get a drink, and they have a ton of different juices, smoothies, and teas--I really like the matcha green latte, which is sweet and smooth. 

While the food is not something to scream about, what I really like about the place is that it is a great place to hang out with friends, chat, and maybe play some games at your table, all while or after you eat the desserts. Other tables are just the same, with large, loud groups or just couples enjoying the atmosphere. So this place often gets crowded late, usually around 10 or 11, as people aren't leaving. The waitresses aren't the most adept at handling overcrowding or seating, so get here earlier and grab a table. Once you're seated, just sit back and enjoy.

An interesting tidbit is that the restroom is upstairs in the building, which means you have to grab the key, go outside, and go in through a separate entrance to access the staircase leading you upstairs to a floor with other businesses.
author: Tony D.

description: Great hangout spot! Staff does not rush you at all so you can relax with friends while enjoying dessert and snacks! Will definitely come back again.
author: Tony S.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. 
The woman making the food and helping us was super sweet and attentive. 
I got fries and then a banana Oreo toast box, and my friend got some mango with sticky rice thing. Visually, my friends dessert was unappealing and much smaller than anticipated, but she said it was really good. My fries were average, which is partly because they were thick and i prefer thin cut fries. The toast box was super big, definitely good to share. It was okay, I think my expectations were higher. The outside crust was good but the inside had a weird texture like croutons (kind of). I would come back again, just would try something else.
author: Shira S.

description:
Was looking for a place to chill basically after dinner and we just wandered into this small little cafe. Will not be back...The first sign should have been when I asked for a latte and the waiter looked at me like I was crazy. For the record, my latte was most definitely not a latte and tasted a lot like instant coffee and not in a good way.

Also -- Minimum of 3 dollars per person after 8 and there are no restrooms (my bladder was dyinggg)
author: Jingxi Z.

description: It's a small cute store! There are tons of choices in desserts and some savory food too, I got the marshmallow Nutella waffle and it was delicious! I would highly recommend it. The food came to our table really quick and the service is great! This place is open till really and will fulfill your sweet cravings
author: Cherry Y.

description: A nice dessert place! The desserts are great. We always come here at least twice a week. Oreo Banana is by far the best
author: Kay AL T.

description:
I really like their honey toast. They offer two sizes for it: mini (6.95) or regular (8.95)! Not many places do that. With that, they have a decent selection you can choose from (around 6-8 types!) I've had the strawberry one and tropical delight. Both were really good! They warn you on the menu that it is a 10-15 wait for the honey toast, so order it right away if you must. Good presentation, I must say.

I also had their mini dessert sampler (9.95) that comes with four mini desserts: tiramisu, macau pudding, mango pudding, and a mini fruit salad. All of it was pretty decent, not really anything to hype up. Something to note was that the macau pudding was frozen.. boo.

I can imagine their sago and other asian desserts are pretty good here. One of my friends had their red bean and green tea pudding which ended up to be pretty small, but he enjoyed it anyways. Next time, I'll try their waffle and ice cream desserts; those seem popular along with the honey toast. I wouldn't trust the pasta here.. which is kinda odd since it IS a dessert cafe. Stick to the dessert, hence the name!

Come here on a weeknight or around 8-9pm on a friday or saturday. I've heard plenty of stories from friends that say this place is OVERLY crowded when it gets to about 11pm. Easy to find parking at night because everything's metered. And as of service, never had a bad problem here.
author: Kathleen S.

description: The service was quick and efficient. The server answered all our questions thoroughly. The food also tasted very good. I have nothing to complain about. I will be back soon. I will recommend to my friends..
author: Sugar Z.

description: My friend brought me here, so it's the first time to be here. The tableware and decoration are very cute and sweet. I suggest the #imitation shark fin soup and the #Honeythicktoast. It's taste pretty good.
author: Elise G.

description:
Over the years I have become a regular for the brick toast because I have yet to find another place that makes it well. 

It took a while for the waitress to take our order. I think she forgot about us until another coworker I recognized noticed us and told her to take out order. You don't go here for the service or atmosphere though, you go for the dessert. 

They added more stuff to the place too like nicer seating. That's cool.  

My boyfriend and I ordered the Strawberry Sweetheart regular size toast. It was delicious. Buttery and sweetened with honey but the flavor comes from the toppings they use. Out of all the toasts, I like the Oreo Banana and the Strawberry Sweetheart best. 

I decided to try the Matcha Red Bean pudding. At $4.50, I expected a juicier serving. It was in a cute little glass cup so it looked nice. Taste wise was pretty good but I was anticipating a thick and creamy pudding but this was like the lighter, jiggly puddings people put in milk tea drinks. I guess similar to panna cotta. 

I want to try the mango coconut sticky rice next!
author: Sofia R.

description: My favorite late night go to by the Sunset area. During the late nights it isn't usually too packed and they have a great selection of food both savory and sweet to choose from. Have lots of rules about paying with cards and splitting and such, but given the area it makes sense. Very cute and girlie and overall always leave satisfied!
author: Devika B.

description: A friend and I were visiting SF from Monterey area when we craved for Asian dessert. We stopped by at ETC dessert cafe and it was just we wanted! I ordered the mango shaved ice with mango ice cream and my friend order the coconut milk with black sticky rice & mango. Service was also great, and the interior was cute! We will definitely return :)
author: Ari P.

description:
First off, this place is freaking adorable- so kawaii
The desserts are good as well- the staff picked up on my girlfriend's and my indecisiveness and were totally patient. Go if you're in the area
author: Wellington C.

description:
Great little(and I mean little) cafe for late night eats and kick-its. 

My friends and I came here after some late night photography shooting in the city. It was around 1am when we finished galavanting. We chose this place(that I previously BM'd), because it was open 'til 1:30am and I wanted to try honey toast(been wanting to try since I saw pics on IG). 

We were rollin 8 deep in da cafe & we were crammed(really, this place is small). You can easily eavesdrop into ppl's conversations while waiting to order at the register. We were able to get a table and snag the couch/table area right across from it. We ordered a lot-- Soups, ramen, spam sandwich, smoothies, calamari, takoyaki, desserts & of course...my honey toast. Everything came out in a timely manner, except for my macaron chocolate party honey toast :( I was the last one to get my order(my friends threatened to leave me when I received my order, lol). It took more than the allotted time it said on the menu. Worth the wait? Chyeah...I think so...

When it came out, I got excited(hooray-yay, cheers)! I had to take multiple shots and angles before my friends and I destroyed it ;) It was looking Nom-worthy. The honey toast was pretty good! Not too sweet, not too flavor lacking. Crunchy, reasonably sized, & delish. BUT they coulda gave me better looking strawberries "/ Anywhoozies, it was pretty good for my first honey toast experience. Price could of been a tad cheaper tho. But hey, the macaron alone is already $1.50-75(compared to other bakerys I've been to). So I settled.

Overall, good food/drinks, reasonably priced menu items, service was good. "Night owl" friendly cafe(some of us ordered more dessert after the 1:30am) & Free Wifi!(YAY). We stayed until 2am.

Just a heads up, if you need to use their bathroom, I suggest not going alone. You have to ask for a key and go next door & walk up a flight of stairs. One of my guyfriends went alone and he said he felt like it was in a scene from The grudge o___O Plus, it's a Unisex bathroom and it smells *(insert stank face emoji here)

Check this place out if you're in the area and you wanna get your K-pop on and your late night dessert/snack cravings on ;D
author: Vicky L.

description: Food was great! their drinks need some improvement though... Really liked their rose latte, but milk tea was below average quality. Toast was on point
author: Luki S.

description: First time here and it did not disappoint. It's a cute little cafe with yummy desserts. We ordered the Oreo Banana honey toast & it was delicious. The regular size was a great sharing size. Very picture-worthy. The taro crema was definitely something I'd come back for.  Great place to hang out with friends!
author: Kristina T.

description:
Nice little place.  We came here in search of honey toast since Akiba was closed.  
We split a Green Tea Red Bean Mini Toast, and it was delicious.  Green tea ice cream on honey toast, what's not to love?  Paired with red beans for a nice extra texture.  I also had one of their Peach Smoothies, good flavors with peaches and bananas.
Don't bother getting takoyaki, I don't recommend it.  There are big chunks of octopus, but the batter isn't great.
author: Karen L.

description:
Atmosphere awesome.

Service cool. Papi amazing, friendly and accommodating.

Family own biz, I appreciate. 

Good place to hang out and chill with friends, family, significant other. Good selection of food and drinks. Some sweet and some savory.

Parking isn't bad after 9PM.

Also a good place to drown sorrows when your brothers are being jerks. I recommend the waffle special. 

H/\VE FUN
author: William S.

description: Service was so friendly, got our delicious desserts at a reasonable time and price... We ordered the creme brulee and waffle #19, both were well presented and delish. Annnd they accept debit!!! Around here, that's kind of a big deal ***** Happy as a Hippo :)
author: Nora M.

description:
The service is nice, my friends and I usually come here after dinner for refreshing treats. Do not get the sampler, God knows what that weird green tea shit in a cup was. The creme brûlée was the only thing saving that. However, everything else was good.  I highly recommend the cold desserts such as the shaved ice or mixed fruits.  

Owners, if you are reading please stop using YouTube, your internet connection takes 10 years to load a song sometimes.  I recommend saving a music video playlist on a usb.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Ehhh its alright. Their food wasn't terrible but it wasn't spectacular either. I probably wouldn't come back since there are just SO many dessert places in SF. They were accommodating though when we asked for a bunch of dessert to go (asian almond tofu thing). Their waffles were eh. Their brick toast was good. I liked that a lot more than the waffles. It was buttery and crunchy and tasted good with the ice cream.

SKIP the wings with fries. they give you four wings and the rest are fries. fries were not very crispy.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Etc. is an extremely friendly place wth great dessert and service. Their tiramisu honey toast is amazing! Can't wait to come back
author: Eric J.

description: Excellent dessert and opens late. Family loves it here. Good variety of food for all to enjoy whether your looking for a cold dessert or a hot dessert even full on meals this place has it
author: Eva K.

description: We ordered the chocolate fondue set and on the menu it says it should come with cheesecake bits, fruits, marshmallows, and ice cream. However, ours came with a waffle instead of the cheesecake bits and they forgot the ice cream. I wish they updated their menu or just followed what's stated on the menu. On the other hand, they have a variety of desserts and would come again to try something new.
author: Kotoko T.

description: Great dessert after we ate PPQ across the street. Got the iforgota and ice cream. I'm sure I spelled it wrong but it was good. We also got a ube coffee.
author: George T.

description: Tried this place for the first time definitely will be back very chill vibe really enjoyed dinning in
author: Emery L.

description: My friend and I ordered the Oreo banana and chocolate macaron party toast. The plate looks really nice and spot on. It seemed like they put a lot of effort into it. It wasn't really sweet which I like. The only down side is the toast. They added raw honey to it and the texture of the toast was too dry and crunchy in my opinion. I couldn't finish it because it was just too much. The overall service is good. The worker that served us was so friendly. She was so patient with us with our order. For sure coming back!
author: Sandra Z.

description: I came here 10 minutes before they closed, which is kind of messed up yeah but my friends and I were looking for somewhere to eat so we ended up here. The waitress was super accommodating, gentle, nice, and just overall great. Would definitely come back!
author: Lili L.

description: I couldn't decide what to get because there are so many great options! Love the decorations too :) meow.
author: Andrea S.

description: We were craving dessert after dinner one night and stumbled upon this little cafe that I always walked past and never noticed. Definitely falls short of the Asian dessert places in SoCal, but it'll do for those late night cravings- not much else to choose from in SF. Brick toast was nicely toasted ? Toppings were generous although a bit lacking in flavor (the green tea ice cream was definitely mediocre, as was the mochi- a bit hard) and the mini size was just right. Setting is definitely a bit old and rundown, bathroom is in the building upstairs and incredibly janky, but it was nice to have a warm place inside to sit and chat over dessert. Price is alright, selection is wide, but quality is just meh.
author: Joy H.

description: Nice place but when I checked in and showed them they told me that I can only get the free stuff for "for here" order but we literally waited for almost 30 mins for our order. So we in here still. Ehhh mediocre food as well
author: Jimbo R.

description:
Desserts:
-Matcha green tea pudding with red bean, too bland
-Green tea ice cream shaved ice with red bean and mochi (I know what your racist mind is thinking, this is different from the dessert above, not all asian desserts are the same) a pile of flavorless shaved ice permeated with uneven green liquid, only good thing about this was the generic strawberry mochies and dollop of Polly Anne's green tea ice cream in this giant bowl
-Macaron party honey toast box was decent, vanilla macaron was pretty chewey as it should be, surprisingly well-toasted honey bread box for north america, though not comparable to ones form asia, could've done without the cheaped whipped cream and chocolate chip pieces

Service and setting:
-Really friendly service by soft-spoken asian girl
-Nice atmosphere for a fob asian place, actually some fucks given to interior decor although a lot of things seem a little mismatched like my fob parents' outfits, loved the white (ikea?) furniture
author: Tian Q.

description: This place is pretty good. We had 7 people and thee dessert was all served on time. They also R gave us 15% off discount since they are grand open.
author: Justin Z.

description: Great service, the fruit waffle was really good and you have to try the fries. Make sure to use the check-in so that you can receive different "tiers" with minimum orders of free desserts!
author: Andrew C.

description: For the price Brick toast is the best thing here but the add ons aren't worth the price.
author: Jacksun F.

description: The strawberry waffle was quite delicious. The black sticky rice in coconut milk with mango tasted much better once I mixed the hot rice and cold milk to make it a uniform temperature. They were able to specially make my friends dessert too! - almond paste with sesame dumplings.
author: Kristie F.

description: Super awesome and cute Asian dessert place in sunset! Love the coconut milk sago with mango :) I always come here when I'm in the area for dinner!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Time: Thursday Night around 11:45pm.
Mission: find a place with ice cream & maybe some food

That shouldn't be too hard right?

Initially deterred by the horrible Yelp reviews, 2/3 of us still wanted to try out the new spot on Irving. Given that it was past midnight when we arrived, parking was not a problem but I see why this is an issue during the day. And YES there are about 9 bazillion other "HK dessert" type places but most of them are overpacked with fobs and screams "Walk in so you can bump into the randomest person you've ever known in life" but how many are open past midnight on a thursday? and aren't in the richmond district. 
+1 for fulfilling our mission

Food:
We ordered the HK Style Imitation Fin Soup, which was pretty good and most places don't have it. I could drink this stuff all day so +1.
The banana split was good and they do offer a variety of ice cream flavors (but this is a pretty hard dish to butcher) As for the Ham & Egg Sandwich, the bread came out too toasty so it tasted a bit weird.

Service&Price:
Cash Only ! So I hope they post bigger signs stating this because we didn't see any and Yelp lied saying that they accept card. (BoFa ATMs are at the end of the block though) Luckily we did have cash & pre-tip for 5 items was around $20.
The Owners were really nice & props to them for being young and opening up your own business. When the waitress came to clean off the table, she saw that my friend had not eaten much of the toasted bread and asked if there was something wrong. She profusely apologized and took in our opinions. Overall though service was good and they don't stare at you with confusion after you converse in English but order in fluent Chinese. +2


If you're looking for something closer to the Sunset, this could be a new place to check out. Review update once I try out more of the menu !
author: Jenn Y.

description: Super cute place with even better food! Got smoothies and an appetizer and it couldn't have been tastier!
author: Natalie D.

description:
Honestly if I could give this place 0 stars I would. 

First my friends and I (4 of us) ordered one toast. Nutella banana marshmallow toast and water. 

the first thing is they gave us water and 4 cups. The water and the water bottle smelled like legitimate piss. Like they washed the bottle, closed the lid and didn't let the inside dry. It was horrible. 

Then when she brought out our toast she said everyone needed to spend a min of $3 dollars after 8 pm. My first question: why wasn't that mentioned when we first ordered. She said sorry and walked away. 

So my friends and I ordered two more dishes to make our $12 minimum. One friend ordered fresh mango and mango ice cream. When she brought it out it was mango juice and mango ice cream. We asked her why we got mango juice instead of fresh mango when the picture clearly shows mango cut into pieces. Our server responds with "oh in Chinese it says fresh mango juice". While I understand that this is just poor communication, don't show mango pieces and say fresh mango and not expect people to think its mango pieces. 

So we ask her if she can add the mango pieces of fruit and she says yes. We also ordered coconut milk with black rice and mango pieces and she Asks if we want hot or Cold. We asked her what was better and she responded by saying the cold was better. 

We received the right mango dessert and the coconut dessert with an added scoop of mango ice cream. 

When we got the bill, not ONLY were we charged for the extra fruit BUT ALSO charged and extra dollar for the mango ice cream in coconut dessert. When I asked her to take these $3.00 dollars off since we didn't even want to spend this much on dessert. She only took off 1.50 saying that she could take off the fruit because she NEVER told us she would charge us but nothing could be done about the coconut dessert because it always comes with ice cream when it's a COLD DESSERT. WHY DIDNT YOU TELL US THAT WHEN WE ASKED YOU WHICH ONE TO PICK. 

Not once did the manager come out and talk to me. And at this point sorry is not enough and does not do anything. 

And the cherry on top was our server telling us that the 3.00 min charge after 8pm is on the menu: let me tell you. ITS IN 7 POINT FONT IN THE BOTTOM LEFT CORNER IN BETWEEN A BUNCH OF OTHER TEXT. THAT SHOULD BE BIG AND BOLDED. 

Besides the SHADY and SNEAKY charges, the server was a nice girl but doesn't seem to know what she is doing. She said sorry a lot but I'm sorry sweety it doesn't help a single bit at this point. 

If you wanna get ripped off by the tiny ass print and have people not help you one bit when you're pissed beyond belief this is the right place for you.
author: Selina Andrea S.

description: Brick toast was delicious. Unfortunately they ran out of matcha ice cream so we will have to come back another time.
author: Cameron M.

description: ETC Dessert Cafe is amazing! I come here all the time for their brick toast especially their strawberry pyramid! Instead of a whole toast, they cut the toast into smaller cubes and each piece is absolutely perfect! The outside is nice and crunchy but the inside is super moist! With the combo of ice cream and condensed milk, it's delightful! Definitely recommend all of you to try it!
author: Ashley L.

description: If there was ever a moment to scream and weep uncontrollably over the goodness of food, it's when you try their Nutella Marshmallow waffle. I never wanted it to end. If ever I'm on death row and they ask me what I want for my last meal it will be that damn waffle. While on my death bed, surrounded by loved ones my final words will be "that damn waffle!" I got the half waffle , but my soul wanted the full waffle. Do yourself a favor and get one.
author: Jared O.

description:
I've been here way before and I actually didn't really like this place too much. I tried their toast maybe like a year or two ago. I recently came back because my friends decided to try this place out. It wasn't busy because we went on a weekday. They are also closed late so that's a  plus! My friends ordered their oreo toast and I tried it, it was actually pretty good! The toast was soft on the inside and toasty on the outside. The flavors my friends picked were a good combination so it tasted really good. I then came back with my sister a week later because she was craving some dessert. I ordered their chicken wings with fries and I thought they were so good! Fried to perfection! The chicken wings were also breaded really nice with a good amount of seasoning too. My sister ordered their mixed fruit grass jelly. I didn't get to try it but she was pretty satisfied after. I've looked at their prices and honestly, this spot is one of the cheapest dessert cafes I know. Very inexpensive! I don't know if they've changed ownership or not but I will definitely be back! 

It's also another plus that they take card here!
author: Joey C.

description: I waited for 2 minutes for seats, but its worthy. The dessert is great, and location is awesome, the service is perfect. I love it. Highly recommended!!!!
author: Kingsley W.

description:
My friend and I ate a light dinner, in hopes that we would find some kind of snack/boba place that intrigued us on Irving Street. We were being super picky and couldn't decide on what to get.

When we saw the menu for ETC in the window and saw HK style desserts, we looked at each other and basically screamed in agreement. We met in Shanghai, and one of our favorite places had this bomb dessert with black rice, mango, vanilla sauce, and ice. We saw this on the menu and basically died because we finally found it in America! Woohoo!

After our first bite, we were sadly disappointed. It was in coconut milk instead of vanilla sauce - not sure how it is normally, but the coconut milk tasted weird. The rice wasn't sticky at all and was too hard. It was just not what we expected, and it was a super tiny portion as well. It wasn't terrible, but I definitely won't be coming back for this dessert.

Still trying to find a place with legit Hong Kong style desserts :(
author: Lisa N.

description: Very cute dessert lounge! We got the matcha brick toast, cold mango sago, tofu pudding, creme brûlée, a rose latte, and honey green tea. It was all very good! The rose latte was a little miss leading bc it tastes like coffee and had no rose flavor what so ever. But despite that, the experience was very nice with some delicious and aesthetic desserts!
author: Tina S.

description: I love dessert sports, and this place is not one that I love or even like. I've been here two times. First time I think I got one of their mini toasts, which wasn't bad. Second time, I got the "tofu fa". It was not food at all. Not sweet and really dry tasting. Bleh.
author: Lina C.

description:
I ordered a Mango Pudding which was meh okay, but a friend ordered a "Mini Oreo Honey Toast" which was so huge so she had to share. This was my very first time trying a Honey Toast, and it was so yummy! I've gotta say, something about 'honey toast' did not sound appealing to me, but this dessert exceeded my expectations!

The portion for a 'mini' was big enough for 3 people to share! Can't imagine what the adult honey toast would be! 

Also the Nutella Waffle they offer for yelp check ins was delicious! 

Overall great and attentive service, minus one star because it did take a while for everything to come out and the Winnie the Pooh theme around the place was a bit odd.
author: Oriel F.

description: So amazing. Perfect place if you're in the mood for an interesting variety of sweets. Highly reccomend the mango milk tea and brick toast
author: Manpreet P.

description: It is our first time there, the food was yummy. I ordered the refreshing lemon tea and my son ordered the lemonade which was sugar water with lemon slices. Great value for the price and amount of food we ordered. I wished that they have sugar syrup for sweet tofu. I'll come back again. Please check in with yelp and FB to unlock their dessert promotion.
author: Carol L.

description: Have been coming to this place for a long time now. Great hang out place,  friendly service, good food and very spacious. I'd recommend this place after a long day or week of work. It is a noisy atmosphere/ can get very noisy, so if you do like quiet dessert places, then this may not be the best for you. I'd recommend the pyramid toast,  any flavor, and the Mango delight.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
It's been one sweet journey trying all six honey toast flavors form ETC! That probably makes me sound like a fatty, but I prefer the term "honey toast connoisseur."

My favorite was the Tiramisu Honey Toast, the most chocolatey of all the flavors. It came with coffee ice cream, a tiny slice of tiramisu cake, sliced strawberries, striped chocolate wafer sticks, and chocolate syrup drizzled all over.

The overall sweetest flavor was the Strawberry Sweetheart. It consisted of vanilla ice cream, strawberry slices, striped strawberry wafer sticks, and a tiny slice of New York cheesecake. Strawberry syrup and powdered sugar topped it all off.

Fruit lovers will enjoy the Tropical Delight. The fruits' natural sweetness paired with mango ice cream created a luscious medley without being overly sugary. It includes fresh kiwi, honeydew melon, cantaloupe, watermelon, strawberries, canned pineapple, and canned peaches.

The Matcha Green Tea Honey Toast features the refreshingly sweet combination of green tea ice cream and sweet red beans. The small pink mochi chunks and chocolate pocky sticks topped off the Japanese theme nicely.
