Oreo cookies, cookies and cream ice cream, and banana slices come together to make the Oreo and Banana Honey Toast. It's topped with chocolate syrup and powdered sugar.

The Macaron Party was the most disappointing. It was an uninspired medley of chocolate ice cream, strawberry slices, chocolate shavings, and one lone vanilla macaron. Granted, you can add extra macarons for a dollar each, but with a name like Macaron Party, it's presumed that there would be more than one macaron.

All the honey toasts are deliciously beautiful desserts to share with family and friends, and ETC provides a cozy environment for doing exactly that!
author: Tanya A.

description: This is my first time at ETC cafe and the experience was good. My bf and I ordered 4 items: rose latte, full size tiramisu honey toast, full size Belgian waffle with Nutella and banana, and calamari. Rose latte came in a  cute coffee mug with a tiny spoon; however, we only finished half of the amount because it was way too sweet. We give the honey toast a 3 out of 5 because we think the honey didn't go well with the dessert. I was expecting the waffle to be crispy, but the waffle turned out to be soft and fluffy which is not I wanted. The calamari was surprisingly really good except that they used ranch instead of tartar sauce. The calamari was seasoned right and tasted fresh too. The calamari is a must when you visit ETC cafe! Highly recommended! Our waiter was friendly, polite and attentive. I give him 5 stars! I would definitely come back for fruit desserts.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Food: After having brick toast from Snowflakes, I knew it was going to be hard finding a comparable brick toast that taste just as delicious, and this place was no exception. The small size break toast was about $6 for one 1 inch slice of brick toast and a couple blocks of buttered toast on the sides, 1 scoop of ice cream, whip cream, fruits, cake, beans, etc. everything tasted just okay, nothing spectacular or anything, but it did give me my sugar fix for the night. 

Service: pretty good service and friendly waitress. Every table got their own water jug which I thought was pretty cool, because usually dessert places like these have a big water jug that is self-served.

Ambiance: this place has a cutesy-Disney-tiger theme. It was however pretty small and the tables were sort of cramped together.  

Not sure if I will be back, because there are so many other dessert places to try in the SF.
author: Samantha F.

description:
My buddy and I needed a quiet place to talk shop after dinner and a drink. Naturally, we sought out some dessert but Tea Way was totally packed so we walked down the street until we stumbled upon a welcoming Hong Kong-style dessert shop glowing bright in the night. We saw some seats inside and also that the closed late so it was the perfect spot to chat.

We shared the marshmallow waffle and matcha green tea pudding, which were both excellent. I was worried that the marshmallow and nutella would be too sweet, but it was just right. The pudding was really strong and had a caffeinated kick to it which was quite nice. There was tons of delicious looking things on the menu and I can't wait to try them on my return visit.

Service was excellent and the couch and armchair were comfy. Prices were reasonable and the portion sizes are great for a late night treat. Most HK dessert places tend to be packed, especially on the weekends but this one has just the right amount of traffic to make it very easy to visit. Plus, it's nearby my girlfriend's place so I'll be bringing her by soon!

Food: 10/10

Service: 9/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Best dessert around sunset area! 
Cute little shop and good food 
My favourite is the green tea toast box
Other than dessert, they have entreé too. The pastas are good, really creamy. Oh and chicken wings Omg.
I took one star out because the shop is small, so some times we might have to wait outside or share table with other customers.
author: Coral N.

description: This place is OK for hangout but not for good desert. Compare to other desert place, they do have something different. However for the money I think they're really good at all. The pricey item like thick toasted bread, is really not worth it. For $9 you got a cone of ice cream and alot of toasted bread. I'll say that's a rip off.
author: Jason L.

description: Very delicious and good service, no need to worry parking and wait for table, my bf loves it so much, and the price is worth and make sence!!!
author: Ying W.

description:
I went here with a group of friends for dessert and ordered the Strawberry Sweetheart Honey Toast. The dessert was big. You should share with another person. The toast was cubed and toasted with honey. The toast was topped with a mini cheesecake slice, strawberry slices, a scoop of ice cream, and 2 mini stick cookies. The toppings and toast went great together. I thought the presentation was very nice. We also ordered the waffles with mixed fruit and ice cream which was also great. 

Service was ok. It did take a while for them to make the toast. They had a lot of Disney plushies on display. I found it strange that you have to go outside the cafe to reach the restroom.
author: Alexander L.

description: Some delicious foods and yummy munchies for the night owls looking for a nice quiet sunset snack!
author: Mozark S.

description:
I've heard of this place but had never been here until a few nights ago. One of the great things about this place is the fact that it's open late night. What a great concept if you asked me because most places open late night are usually fast food restaurants or drive through's which are never healthy for you anyways. But at least when you eat these desserts, you don't feel so guilty because there so darn good.

Although it's very small when you first pull up you recognize that you're in the right place because it has blue Christmas lights sprawled out from the front windows all the way through the café. It's a little funky but in my opinion pretty cool because I love Christmas lights. My party and I we're given seats and the waitress came pretty quickly to take our orders. Unfortunately that was one of only two positive things that came from my time here. The second was the fact that the servings are huge. Even the small serving sizes need two people to finish.

Are order took 20 minutes to reach our table which normally wouldn't be bad but the café was completely empty. That is except for the staff and their friends, who seem to have their own table and clearly made themselves comfortable here. Really 20 minutes for two desserts that is insane to even think about!! If that's how long it takes to make two desserts in an empty cafe, I wonder how you guys even stay open.

Regardless when I got my Oreo honey toast dessert it was great. It was light and fluffy and when the ice cream began to melt, it flowed and covered the toast in sweet goodness. As I wipe the drool from my mouth just thinking of how good it was, haha...I then realize that it began to go down hill even worst after that. So after we finished out food, it took another 20 minutes for our waitress to come back to our table to check up on us. That's 40 minutes of waiting time in between our desert. It seems the waitresses were too busy having fun with their friends to even come and check up on us. 

Although I know it was late at night you still have customers and they should always be top priority especially when we're paying for our food. Overall great food for service just something to really think about before you come here. Maybe it could've been an off evening for the staff but at the end of the day, customers should always take priority over anything. But that's just my opinion!
author: Donald W.

description: Ordered the strawberry toast! Super delicious! The hazelnut latte is also good. Small little place but cozy. The girl who served us was super attentive. Nice little spot to grab dessert.
author: Ciplada R.

description:
The honey toast (I got tiramisu) is very good. At first, I was afraid to eat it. Such a large piece of toast, how can I eat it gracefully? Usually if I hang with my bros I wouldn't mind "how" to eat my food, but this time I was with my girlfriend and her sisters so I did not want to eat like a cave man. I trembled with fear.

When the toast arrived, I was very pleased to find out that the toast is actually cut into small pieces so it is very easy to eat. I scooped up a piece of toast and put some ice cream on it, and the taste was heavenly. It was a little crunchy, a little honey sweet, and covered with cool, ice creamy flavor. It's very different from your typical ice cream.

Make sure you split your honey toast with friends, it's too much for one person. 

Eventually, conversation got boring, and the waitress lend us cards to play with. The service was awesome and it was a great place to hang out after dinner. I recommend it.
author: Song Z.

description: Good for the frozen treats like green tea ice cream or coconut sago.
author: Xtina W.

description: I've been here  a few times. Their honey brick toast is really good, I'd recommend it. I've tried their strawberry and green tea matcha flavors, but I think all their brick toast flavors are pretty good. I've also had the sampler platter which had chicken wings, calamari and takoyaki. I've had good experiences here with their food & service.
author: Bailey L.

description: Great avocado and banana smoothie! The tiramisu is really fluffy. Open late night too which is good.
author: Monica K.

description:
Came here on Saturday night, pretty busy.
Amazed at the menu, so many varieties.
Ordered mango sago; coconut milk almond black sticky rice and fried chicken. Great as late night snacks.

The deco and environment are really cute. 
Will be back to try out the pastas and toast with ice cream.
author: Jimmy K.

description: This place had a lot of choices of beverages and lots of Asian desserts. The decor was a bit over-the-top pink and cutesy and probably something you'd expect to see in Japan...but...if Asian desserts is what you want, this place probably has a good amount of that covered.
author: Leo M.

description:
Pretty LED blue lights in hang in the large windows and lure me in almost immediately.

One cold December night, babe and I went in for a sweet treat. The restaurant was completely empty upon arriving to the doorstep and leaving the threshold when we were done. The restaurant does have a sort of comforting, coziness to it.

I ordered the chocolate fondue and babe ordered the sesame paste with glutinous balls. My chocolate fondue was small in portion and the chocolate wasn't very good. :( I've had better at Genki Ramen... (specialty in ramen, lol) and the sesame paste was luke warmish and lacked flavor.

3.5 for service and 2 for the dessert. Don't think I'll be coming back unless I hear that there has been some improvement in their desserts.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
We wanted honey toast for dessert so we opted to try this place out & ordered the Tiramisu Coffee Honey Toast. You could really taste the honey, which was great,  but the toast was overly dry and the edges nearly burnt. Coffee ice cream was creamy and strong flavor. The tiramisu flavor came from a small slice of cake that tasted like it. Different flavor for a honey toast but wouldn't order again. 

Located across from Tpumps and between Honeyberry & Ichiban on Irving St, it is hard to find parking.

Use cash or they'll charge you a fee to use card.
author: Kitty K.

description:
The brick toast is yummmy! But really pricey. We ordered the one with choco syrup, strawberries, and vanilla ice cream. That thing came out to like $10+
Its not something i wud come back for
author: Alyssa C.

description: The food is so bomb and the place is so cute, love it! Service was great, the lady was really nice. Would come again.
author: Abi M.

description: I really liked the honey toast. I've been looking for honey toast since I moved to the bay. I also liked the ambiance of the place. It's really chill and they also have a lot of food option. There's even pasta!!! Will be coming back again :)
author: Ina S.

description: Many choices for desserts! Nice quiet place. Good service. Great for couples on dates! :)
author: Vita N.

description:
Got on the hype and deciding to try this place out!

got the tiramisu honey toast and oh my goodness, it was one of the best honey toasts I've had.  The texture of the tiny bits was crunchy but slightly softer on the inside, so if that's the texture you like, you'll be a fan of this as well.  If you're more into the soft chunks, you may want to go elsewhere.  Also ordered the taro sago and it was fairly decent, nothing too special.  I had not eaten dinner that day as well so I ordered the butter waffles and "chichen" lolol I kid you not, the menu says that, but it's cute.. hahah my friend and I couldn't get over it :)  It was pretty good too! I definitely want to come back and try the other stuff as well.  The menu sounds pretty nomlicious and there's such a good variety to order from!

Also, the girl that was working there was super nice and though it take a little longer for the food, her service just accommodated for it.  Super sweet!

And as usual, I beat the crowd so I can't say much about waiting time.
author: Lisa L.

description: Quant little restaurant on Irving Street   I pass it all the time yet the store front never caught my attention.  We were looking for Taiwanese Ice and ETC Dessert Café appeared on Yelp.  My family ordered the Fruit Slush topped with mango ice cream and the honey toast with fresh fruit.  The fruit was fresh and the slush was oh so refreshing.  Both were large enough to share.  Looking forward to trying something new next time.
author: J H.

description: It's a good place to hang out. I love that they have many good desserts and savory food!! Nice service too!! I will recommend the honey toast here. Many choices too!
author: Eggie S.

description: Yummy stuff. Much love. I love that they're open late so friends and I can hang out here. They have a good variety of desserts, drinks and snacks. Perfect for late night.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Very cute, dead empty when I went. Note that their restroom is in the building next to it in this random as hell hallway. Haha felt really sketchy but it was fine.

Curry Toast - boyfriend devoured it. tasty!
Honey Chicken and Waffle - Skip, it works for a craving but I think there are better items on the menu
Honey Toast - Tiramisu. We got the mini. It was delicious. I love honey toast now. :)

Cute place, I would go again, plus its near honeyberry, and t-pumps. Can't go wrong.
author: Samantha D.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: Easy street parking at night.  No wait.
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star:  Nice blue lights.  Average service. 
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

2/3 Stars:  I had a chocolate party and it was pretty good.  I just wish it didn't take an additional 15 minutes to make.
_____


Overall Experience
4/5 Stars 

_____

Pictures

Chocolate Party: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/etc-dessert-cafe-san-francisco?select=5mC4IAIsKmlMIvcxkPDB2w#5mC4IAIsKmlMIvcxkPDB2w

Waffles and Oreo Ice cream: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/etc-dessert-cafe-san-francisco?select=ay2gNuT8GsOSNCN5TAWZ_Q#ay2gNuT8GsOSNCN5TAWZ_Q

_____

Last Words

I would go again
author: Elliott N.

description:
It is now official that ETC is our two top Chinese dessert place in San Francisco~
Reason being: my Cantonese food fiend friend loves it, says it is legit and innovative. And truth is their cold fruit dessert is quite decent (occasional use of canned fruits - not a surprise, not a secret, but the saigos are fresh and abundant!), their hot traditional desserts are stellar (Taro+red bean paste). 

Innovation is what matters the most: I like their almond paste over tofu fa (which is "Tofu flower", which is very very soft silky tofu), and gosh the smore monster of marshmallow on waffles~ 

We were won over. Love the friendly atmosphere too, really chill, cute - like the lights blue is perfect for winter
author: Dilys S.

description: Family size brick toast was yums, great for eating out with friends. Can have lots of fun and lots of toppings with it
author: Kevin S.

description:
I wouldn't necessarily come here for a legitimate dessert.

You come for a late night spot to hang out with your fellow Asian brethren, drink milk tea, and eat honey toast.

This spot was open on Thanksgiving (duh). My friend said the milk tea was pretty good but I went with an avocado shake. It was aaaaaaa-okay.
author: Susy C.

description: Waitress was super nice and informative. They also had a great selection of amazing desserts. Everything I have here blows my mind every time. 10/10 would eat again.
author: Ethan S.

description: Their grass jelly is really good if you like sweet things. I love their brick toast because it's coated in condensed milk!
author: Verrone L.

description:
As my first time here, I have to say, I was pretty satisfied!

We ordered two mini-sized toasts, one with a macron it and another called Tropical Delight, which had pieces of mango, watermelon, and all the other tropical fruits as so described by the name of the dessert. The toast was nice, crunchy, and soft. The sweetness was perfect and it was easy to eat too; when you cut it apart, it breaks easily into square pieces. We shared these 2 with 3 people. So perfect portions for dessert after dinner if you aren't too hungry! I've seen the normal-size and that's perfect to share amongst two people!

The service is good. Since we were 10 people and the place was small, they were still able to somehow accommodate us as best as they can, not just with tables, but with menus, forks, and plates.

If you're looking for dessert and something interesting and not too heavy for your taste buds, this is the place to go!
author: Tina R.

description:
Gotta love this place for staying open til midnight. Cause seriously, late night sweet cravings are a VERY regular thing in my life! 

First off, the interior is extremely pink. So pink that it makes you feel like you're in a Hello Kitty or Sanrio store. We ordered the tiramisu honey toast, avocado smoothie, and honey chicken creamy mushroom pasta.
-Tiramisu Toast ($8-9): big, real big, and beautiful presentation. But only big because of how much bread you're getting, not the goodie toppings (small piece of tiramisu, chocolate sticks, coffee ice cream, and whipped cream). The toast is super crunchy, like you're eating honey-sweetened croutons. Definitely go with their smaller size order, which will give you the same amount of topping with a smaller more proportionate toast.
-Avocado Smoothie ($3.50): not as avocadoey as I've had and like. Almost like they blended a little too much ice into it and diluted it. Still good and refreshing though!
-Honey Chicken Mushroom Pasta ($7-8?): healthy serving of chicken served hot with the creamy pasta. Interesting mix of the sweetness from the honey chicken with the savory creamy pasta that my friend really enjoyed.
-Mini Banana Split (free with check-in and $20): very simple. Sliced banana with 2 small scoops of vanilla and chocolate ice cream. No fudge or toppings, but hey it was free!

Service can be slow with only 1 server, but she was very sweet. I'll definitely be back to try their other desserts or milkshakes!
author: Andrew T.

description:
My #1 weakness, dessert...

I was so excited to see that they had honey toast so of course I had to try it. I got the one with all the fruits on it and I decided to go with vanilla ice cream. I love vanilla ice cream! 

The toast took about 20min to come out and it looked super delicious buttt when I started shoving it into my face it was just OK. The toast wasn't sweet enough for me :( I was expecting the outside to be crunchy, which it was, and the inside to be soaked in honey but half of the bread on the inside was still crunchy. Fruits and ice cream were pretty good but I was really hoping the bread would be like Guppys brick toast :/

Service is w/e unless your hella down with fobby Chinese girls. If you ever need to use the bathroom, make sure to have a buddy system. It's upstairs in the building next to ETC and at night its empty and creepy.
author: Harry T.

description: I love this dessert place because it's in the outer  sunset and easy to find parking at night.  The staff is nice and the food is delicious.  If you are from Asia and feeling homesick, this is the place to go!
author: P Y.

description:
Horrible horrible shaved ice. The ice was hard and not fluffy. The green tea ice cream on top of the ice was even harder. It was a mission impossible to get a spoonful of the ice cream. The red beans were way too dry as if they were left outside for way too long. Gosh it was just awful.
The almon paste was better. Maybe their hot desserts are better in general?
author: Jojo L.

description:
tip: great service, but the food doesn't completely match up with the pictures.

Tiramisu brick toast was good but a lil disappointing because since the dessert is called tiramisu they shouldn't throw in a store bought slice of tiramisu and integrate it in the dessert (should make their own); also the brick toast is built from small pieces instead of one big brick toast which was creative but i prefer the latter.  the green tea red bean pudding didn't match up with the menu picture because the real thing came in a small plastic cup with mushy red bean (overcooked).

overall, it's an average dessert joint with some savory foods offered as well
author: Jacky K C.

description:
good dessert! However the drinks are my favorite part. If you get anything fruity order it with Sago (not sure if thats the correct spelling)

staff are super sweet!
author: Larisa V.

description: If I could give a 3.5, I would. The food is GREAT, but the place is so small that you'll be lucky to get in, especially on weekends when you're most likely to go.
author: Austin M.

description:
I love this place. So many delicious sweets and beautifully composed choices. Whatever choice you make you can't go wrong.

You gotta love their waffle ice creams and my absolute favorite, the Baked brick toast with ice cream, fruit, and a slice of Tiramisu cake all in one. I will post up some pictures to explain exactly what I'm trying to describe.

This time I went dessert crazy! Ordered a variety of dishes with a couple of my close friends, coffee-toffee ice cream, and a slice of rich chocolate cake topped with raspberries and topped it all off with their specialty sauce. 

Yes, we ate it all at one sitting, we couldn't  believe it ourselves. All the desserts we ordered truly were...um...extraordinary, we were sugar-buzzed for the rest of the day.

Service was friendly and energetic. I highly recommend a stop here for a sweet treat. 

The server here named Eva, gave us excellent service, I definitely recommend her, she was also the same person that made our desserts, that's a bonus! Describe how you like it, and she'll prepare it the way you want it!

I would recommend all my friends coming to ETC for afternoon or midnight snacks! I'm a happy customer.
author: Steven M.

description:
This place ROCKS! If you like dessert at all, come here for sure. This reminds me of the 24/7 cafes in East LA, where you get good food for cheap!

Came here with my sister on a Friday night around 11pm for some good sister time and desserts. Wait wasn't bad, and they have free wifi. Crowd is very Asian (duh) and student-y. There's one leather love seat with a single armchair across, which gives a little bit more of an intimate space if you're on a date.

We ordered a plate of fries (my weakness), a waffle with nutella and TOASTED SMORES (sister's weakness), a honey toast with strawberries and chocolate ice cream (if you don't know what honey toast is, it's a thick toast they carve into cubes, toast, and place back into the crust (which is left whole and in tact), mixed with fruits, honey, and ice cream). ALL DELICIOUS.

Plus you're offered free hot tea, with great service. Also had the caramel milk tea and it tastes like milk tea you get in Asia, which is bomb-dot-com.

All that for about $15. Talk about a great sister gab session with amazing food!!! Will definitely be back!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Alright, I have to admit that my stomach was already pretty pissed with me by the time my friend and I got here, having been abused with so much food and drink already. But, we were in the area, and we'd both been wanting to try honey toast for a while, so onward we went. 

Settling for something a little bit more reasonable (portion wise), we ordered one of their mini honey toasts, with fruit, a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and chocolate drizzled all atop [ http://flic.kr/p/cfz68f ]. After about a 10-15 minute wait as they toasted the bread (I was incredibly distracted/engrossed with the K-pop that was playing on their TVs, anyhow), we dug in to what was, all in all, an awesome dessert. The bread was toasted just right, soft on the inside with a lightly toasted exterior, and tasty toppings. My only qualm, if I had to choose, was that I wish there was a bit more fruit (and that I wasn't so terribly full).

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - No issues with the entrance or interiors. While the cafe is small, things are spaced apart well so there's plenty of space.

Bathroom - Pretty sure they don't have one.
author: Johnny W.

description: I haven't written a Yelp review in years but this place deserves notoriety. Some of the desserts are unique (at least to me) and so delicious!  A must is the Tiramisu coffee honey thick toast.  A 'regular' size is big enough for two and is brioche cut into cubes then toasted and roped with a cube of a very good tiramisu, a scoop of coffee ice cream, vanilla ice cream, all in a slightly crispy, slightly chewy brioche crust bowl.  Wow.  Not overly sweet, great mix of textures. I also enjoyed a coco mango sago drink- cool, refreshing and textures by the sago.
author: C N.

description: Ew. Not good. Nothing special. Do not get the matcha green tea ice cream on shaved ice.
author: Belia P.

description: Their tiramisu brick toast is very good! The toast inside is warm, crisp, buttery and sweet and chopped up into little squares. Then it is topped with ice cream and a piece of tiramisu. Simple but great.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description: Quick service and delectable desserts- a wonderful accidental find in a very diverse neighborhood. I had the Tiramisu waffle and the silky tofu pudding, both were really good.
author: M L.

description:
mMmmmm dessert toast!

I came late Saturday night with friends. This place was empty so the service was good. After asking her to refill our tea, I didn't have to ask again the rest of the night. She came over and refilled it fairly often!

Here is what I tasted/ordered:

Tri Berry Toast ($8.95): I thought this toast was good for two, but when the lady started to give us plates with tongs and forks... I was thinking, hrm... I don't want to share! When the toast came out, I was like DAMN! This dessert was HUGE! Toasted to perfection, but the downside is that they don't give enough fruit. At the end, my friend had to scrape the bottom of the plate for the toast to get some chocolate syrup and ice cream lovin. Still a good dessert item! Would come back and get it again. http://s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3jtVh_TAXcSjt0ZYANddLA/l.jpg

Waffle with banana, strawberry and ice cream ($4.95): This was also yummy, but a bit too dense for a late night snack. Waffle was not soggy or undercooked, which is a good thing! If I wanted dessert in the day time, I would order this dish. http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/urU7A9v4Iktk3eeCF4-wZA/l.jpg

Takoyaki ($4.95): you definitely get chunks of octopus, but I don't think this was really made the way takoyaki is supposed to be made. I just think this was pre-packaged and then put  into the fryer when someone orders it. My friend said he would come here again for takoyaki because not a lot of places give that much octopus pieces in each takoyaki and this place has two big pieces in each ball. http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/u82R_NPj6AGDIPUO1meKQQ/l.jpg

Overall, I am a fan of this place, I would come again for their desserts!
author: Erica T.

description:
Went there on Sunday for the first time and wow their plates are definitely pretty! The tastes were also great. We got a whole bunch of different things (i can't recall their name" but pyramid something, mango delight, mixed fruits shaved ice, waffle w/ ice cream, and one more i forgot. They all tasted wonderful! Looked amazing! 

One downside though was that it took almost too long for the food to come out. We all got our orders at different times and since it took much much longer for some of us, the ones who got theirs first had already finished before we even got ours. Some of our orders took 10-20 mins to come out. Though they told us it might take a while, we didn't expect it to be that long. Especially when there was no other table ahead of us. 

Great! But definitely not a place to go if you just wanna grab a quick dessert!!
author: Verdina P.

description: We stopped by here for some honey toast dessert after dinner. Outside of the cool YouTube music videos that they stream on their TV, this place isn't all that great. I had a craving for honey toast and this was the closest option. Unfortunately, the reviews of "crouton-like" is completely dead on. The pieces inside the toast were completely crunchy with no flavor. The ice cream was your standard run in the mill. The place seems to be family owned and ran; the people were very nice so nothing against them but this is not a place I can recommend anyone going to for dessert. They did have random bottles of Ace and Dom P. for some reason; that made it interesting.
author: Jimmy D.

description:
Do not get anything besides the fantasy desserts, it will not be worth it.
I tried the mango sago tofu pudding, got sick of it after 3 spoons.
I hate how this place opens at 6pm...
author: Josie D.

description:
It is not bad or good; average really. With many HK-cafe substitutes within a few blocks - on the same street - the "newness" factor is the most likely reason I would return.

Pros:
Newly opened
Good clean working furniture
Criss-cut fries instead of regular fries
Lobster balls were good

Cons:
Milk tea was mostly hot water w/condensed milk; little tea
Did not have a couple of items we wanted
So-so chicken wings
Street parking is harder to find on this block

Kudos to the waitress who did her best, and kudos to the youngish owner(s) for opening a business that is already saturated. However, they were sitting not that far away might have even heard some of our requests. And, instead of asking us while sitting nearby, waited for the waitress to ask her what our requests were...
author: Peter L.

description: Friendly staffs and very good service, the thick toast dessert are the rare and tasty. And you can go with some asian style dessert like tofu fa. We will be back.
author: Leanna L.

description:
I went here last night at around midnight as opposed to the usual Creations outing. The place is pretty small, but a group left just as we arrived so we were seated quickly. 

We got the Tiramisu Coffee Honey Brick Toast & Waffles w/ Mixed Fruit. The honey  toast was really good & the bread was toasted perfectly. The only part I didn't like was the crust holding everything together (it was too hard).  The waffles & fruits were so-so. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't super good either. 

I would definitely try this place again and get the other desserts they have, but it's not at the top of my list. Akiba is still my favorite for honey toast!
author: Jillian Y.

description:
This is a great place to come and chillax with your friends and get desserts. They serve the thick toast bread with lots of variations on toppings. I've only been here twice and tried the tiramisu coffee thick toast (super yummy!! definitely my favorite so far) and the oreo banana thick toast (this was just ok...) 

They also serve lots of other things like snacks (we had the takoyaki (squid balls pretty good, spam and egg ramen (I can make this at home), buffalo wings (not spicy at all.. just taste like regular wings), and mango sago (very refreshing).

I'd definitely come back again even tho it's out of the way...
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Let's welcome Irving's NEW Hong Kong dessert joint, ETC!

Their illuminating blue fading lights can be quite difficult to miss late in the evening, which is how it caught our (my girlfriend and I) eyes. Upon entering the small but spacious cafe, your eyes will dilate to their bright white and orange interior walls while K-pop is bumpin' in your ears (due to their beautiful 46" LED flat screen). My girlfriend didn't mind whatsoever since a couple of 2NE1 music videos were stuck on repeat.

Sesame Paste with Rice Balls ($4.25) - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=zKVo88dC1dvCazQCfFI46g&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
I'm not much of a fan of sesame paste so this dessert wasn't for me (my girlfriend's order). The rice balls wasn't as firm as I wanted it to be, resulting in a mushy texture (if you like your rice balls like that) and the paste tasted a little grainy-like. 

Fresh Mango & Coconut Milk with Black Sticky Rice ($4.50) - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=6sjrW1eQB1tT2sbH-_uTVA&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
The mangoes were fresh as stated, but there wasn't a ton of it. I know it's not in season yet so I won't dock em' for it. On the other hand, the warm black rice blended with the coconut milk created a really refreshing hot dessert.

Hong Kong style Waffle with Banana and Ice Cream ($4.50) - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=X3Xj9JhEBqbyyTBruRgKCg&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
The waffle was warm and fluffy, the slices of banana were drizzled with light chocolate and sweet syrup and need I mention, you get 2 scoops of ice cream! I did wish that the dessert could have been arranged together more as one instead of segregated on the plate (see picture). If placed on top of each other, the warm waffle should slowly melt away some of the ice cream while the bananas and syrups seeps into each nook and cranny of the waffle -- that's how I'd do it.

ETC hasn't perfected their desserts quite yet, but considering their grand opening was only a few days ago, it looks like they know what they're doing. Complimentary hot tea for all guests is a standard. ETC also serves up Chocolate Fondue set (served with mixed fruits and cotton candy) which is new to many HK-style dessert joints I've been to, so kudos! 

Overall, it's really affordable, not to shaby desserts for their soft opening, open late for your 4th meal shennanigans, and extremely friendly hospitality and service. I hope you like k-pop!

PS: I have to add this. 
Their restroom is not within the cafe, but actual in the next door building, up the stairs. If it's late in the night and you need to make that head call, DON'T GO ALONE!! Seriously, it's pretty dark in the building and it even gave me goosebumps while I was going (felt like a scene from the grudge).
author: Albert L.

description:
SO i came back and tried their mango pudding.  It was UNDERwhelming.

We got it to go because it was really late, and it came in a pretty fair sized Styrofoam container.  It was just SO small, and the fruit was canned and just not very good.  There are SOME times when canned fruit it okay.  Canned peahes are pretty good, and sometimes pears, but if I'm going to order a slightly overpriced mango pudding, I want MANGO pudding, condensed milk, and little bit of Fresh fruit.  

However, I would DEFINITELY go back here for the TOAST! :D
author: Aly A.

description:
This place was so cute! And the waitress was super nice!

We came to try the honey thick toast and ordered the strawberry one, and not only was the presentation beautiful, but it was DELICIOUS! Basically, they carve out the inside of a piece of bread, an cut it into cubes, and toast it with butter + honey! Then place it into the bread shell, add ice cream, cheesecake, and strawberry syrup... yummm!
We also tried the waffle with mixed fruit + ice cream, which was yummy as well, but not as novel as the toast. 

Would definitely come back to have more honey toast!
author: Audrey G.

description:
It's hard to miss this place when you go at night. They have those beautiful blue lightings hanging from the ceilings, covering the entire window. When you go inside, it feels like a warm, cozy place. Owners/Servers are really friendly and sweet. They've JUST opened, so I understand that they may have a lot to improve, but I can see that they're trying their best to satisfy the customers.

I had their ETC Dessert Cafe Grass Jelly Special, chicken wings, and curry fish balls. They're delicious!!! I'm definitely going back again!
author: Peggy C.

description: It's an ok plane... Nothing to race about... Just limited service and open forty late night dessert
author: M W.

description: We had our second visit to this place, the atmosphere/decode has definitely improved, and the honey toast and creme brûlée were both better than I remembered. The mango sago type dish we tried was a bit thick on the concentrate that they use as the base and could have used more sago, but over all I feel that this place has definitely improved. The service was also faster than last time which is always a plus.
author: Sarah L.

description: This place is really small and the service isn't the best, but the brick toast here is worth the visit. I had the strawberry cheesecake brick toast which was so satisfying after a long day of exploring golden gate park.
author: Kern S.

description: First time I came here I ordered the grass jelly mountain and the strawberry honey toast. The quality of their food is very mediocre and I wouldn't deem this the best place to get your brick toast fix. The grass jelly mountain didn't taste as good as it sounds; it's something I wouldn't order again. The second time I came back I got the chicken wings and matcha green tea brick toast. All I can remember is how salty all the food was. The chicken wings were definitely frozen and they just reheat it before they serve it. Some of our chicken wings were still cold...which was kind of disgusting. And the matcha green tea brick toast was extremely salty. Maybe they made their bread differently that time but I had trouble finishing it without drinking 2-3 cups of water. Overall, I wouldn't come back here unless I was really desperate for dessert and every other dessert places in SF was closed.
author: Annie V.

description: we came in because this place was the only one open on the block. I really like the fast service and the food was really good. they gave us free tiramisu for a 20$ bill with a check in. the waitress turned tables quickly and had a lot of patience when we were ordering. the interior design is very cute with pink walls and fun decorations.
author: Gina N.

description:
I came here two times already for their honey toast box! Both times I got the banana berry (which is not on the menu) but I saw it on yelp. The first time I had it, it was amazing. The crust was Crunchy and easy to eat. The second time I came here, they used a different kind of bread but I didn't like that one because the crust was hard and rubbery? So it was hard to break off and eat. So sad.


I really hope you guys change it back to the old one!! Please !
author: Emi K.

description:
I've been here so many timmmmees, I always love their waffles / brick toast.
Service is amazing.
I bring my friends as well. I've never tried any of their drinks except their smoothies and they're yummy.
I'm not feeling the shaved ice tho or the tofu. But otherwise the other things are pretty good :)
author: Donna C.

description: Ehh, service here is not so great. Portion sizes are pretty small. I mean, it's not expensive, but the quality of the food is also mediocre. The waffles could come out burnt, or maybe right? It's hit or miss. Tables are easy to find early on, but even the ice cream isn't very flavorful. You can do better. Janky menus inside plastic wraps. Hilarious.
author: Danny C.

description: We always get  the tornado potato and the takoyaki every time we come here. The wait is never too long. Their brick toast taste heavenly. Man there is just isn't enough adjective to describe the food here would definitely recommend to other friends and families.
author: Jeffrey K.

description: Decent Hong Kong Style Desserts! The wait for the table was incredibly long on a Saturday night but it was worth the wait. Had the mango dessert and it was good.  Can't wait to come back again.
author: Janet W.

description:
The place is cute and cozy, a nice hang out spot.
There was alot of choices on the menu, but I had to try the tick toast. 
I tried the tiramisu toast and it was delicous, I loved it.
It's big so you can share with friends. 
I will definity come back for it and also try their other varieties too.
author: Jen W.

description:
Ate here yesterday around 11:30pm. It was possibly one of the only places that was open this late in the city to help satisfy my sweet tooth. 

The restaurant is a bit tiny and we lucked out with some seats.  It's very simple and plain decor in the restaurant. Nothing too fancy, but definitely not ghetto. 

The staff was very courteous and seated us immediately and was really helpful with the ordering and just recommendations and such. 

Ended up ordering the Grass Jelly Shaved Ice with green tea ice cream:
-ice cream was delicious and we ended up getting two scoops before hand and I am glad we did so 
-portion is standard on this 
-the ice wasn't really soft and felt hard and had thicker pieces, which I felt was the come down for this dessert. 

Was still hungry so my fatass ordered the chocolate macaroon toast: 
-the toast inside was pretty delicious and good 
-the macaroon was hard and not the typical soft kind that you'd expect 
-the chocolate ice cream was well, just like how it should be, chocolatey 

Overall, this dessert looked better than it really tasted. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing. I can definitely pass on this for next time. Damn those photos! They tricked me! 

Pricing for this dessert place is pretty reasonable. Both desserts came out to be around $14ish 

The also accept credit cards, but uses the app called Square so they will add a .20 fee if you choose to use this method of payment.
author: Suzie B.

description: Nice and cute place, marshmallow waffle is my favourite. Strawberry sweet heart honey toast is delicious.
author: Narisa A.

description:
It wasn't all that great. My friends decided they wanted to get desert after our dinner at san tung. So we decided to give this place a try, since it was the nearest and open. We ordered the creme brulee, strawberry and waffles with ice cream, and mango pudding for me. The creme brulee was meh.. tasted like refrigerated store bought. The best thing about the strawberry and waffles was the ice cream. And the mango pudding was not good. The best part of the mango pudding was the fresh fruits that came on top of the pudding. and as for the pudding, the texture was mushy and flavor was bland. 
I feel bad for giving two stars but i just cant bump it up another one.
author: Tina D.

description:
This small cafe has a BIG menu. First of all, their brick toast is much better than Akiba! They are loaded with a variety of fruits and ice cream. It's a little heavy and big for one person so I recommend to share. Also try to avoid weekends and high traffic hours because this place only has about 6 tables so if you're in a hurry and don't want to wait for your dessert fix, there are a few more options around the area.

Other wise, I like their extensive menu selections. They have a creative combination of drinks and I will return on an slow day.
author: Elaine Y.

description: The food were so delicious and good services. I got Takoyaki and Taramisu Toasted. I got pasta also. That's so yummy! I can tell I will back soon :)
author: Zin P.

description: First timer with my friend. We ordered a pyramid toast with strawberry ice cream on top of it. Its honey toast tastes great. In addition, my friend ordered a cup of green tea ice cream with red bean. Tastes so fresh. Love this place!
author: YY Z.

description:
Really tiny place but has some long sofas for larger parties.  

The green tea red bean honey toast is not bad.  The toast came out warm which accentuated the honey and had a nice crisp and soft texture. However, the rest of the ingredients seemed to be processed or come straight out of a can.  

The takoyaki is nasty. Don't order it.

Probably won't be back because there are better options in the city. Heck, even down the street.
author: Renee L.

description: We got the green tea pyramid, iced green tea latte and Nutella toast. The food is great and this is definitely a good place to hang out with your friends. Five star dessert place!!!
author: Lori W.

description:
A) .30 cent charge per card used to pay the bill.....

B)tiramisu brick toast taste like deep fried bread from a failed french fry experiment...

C)1 incompetent waitress for a seating space of 20..The raiders have more depth on their roster then you guys...and when you get your menu, it looks like something made in a kindergarten classroom thats not even laminated, but just sealed in a GLAD Ziploc bag.

D)Even attractive looking asian girls here get shit service....strip clubs give you more service when your paying the cover charge than what you get here...the only way you really get service is by being buddy buddy with the FOBS who work here...and i mean HK speaking fobs, not the american chinese speaking asians...

E)They don't wear gloves when they handle uncooked foods and switch to taking care of condiments, sauces, syrups for the toast...you may end up getting food poisoning...trust me... its almost as bad as Mr Fong in Daily city ..(gag)

F)The blender they use looks, seems and sounds like a holdover from the previous establishment that existed before ETC took over...it not cozy...its tacky and cramped in here....like a undersized karaoke bar....

G)How the hell does your front door handle look cleaner than your cashier counter top? oh wait a minute, you guys don't even have a fitted cashier space, let alone a competent worker as your cashier....another broken asian stereotyped expectation.. ...

Overall Result: This place makes taco bell across the street feel homey and welcoming.... ETC is not worth it...

--When the room is full of fit/skinny/slim asian females, theres no way the space is so supposed to be crowded like the DMV lobby area......congratulations to ETC you found a way to do it....


E.T.C = Eat Their Cr*p.....you can fill in the missing letter.

-----------Final Grade 0/7:Failure-----------
author: Eric C.

description:
This reminds me a lot of Shooting Star cafe in Oakland. Although ETC serves similar desserts,  plays melodic tunes during the peak hours of midnight, it is a little more cramped and FAR from where I am from. There isn't anything magical about ETC that persuades me to come back other than it closes late. 

My friend and I split curry fish balls and the special snack platter. Portions were small. The snack special included: fried potstickers, fried squid, fried chicken and a dough/potato/squid pastry. 

My favorite was the curry fish balls. The other were salty and highly mediocre. Maybe I should've tried their desserts instead.
author: Phuong V.

description:
My buddy's friend came into town and she wanted to go to a Asian dessert place so I decided on trying this place since my fellow yelpers recommend it, according to the 4 stars. hehe

I ordered green tea ice cream on waffle and fruits. A lot of the fruits were sour and I can tell some were canned, oh well what can I expect? A bonus to this place is that they play k-pop! HAHA The waitress was nice and polite so that's a another plus. I couldn't stop turning around to watch the MVs. My friends didn't really enjoy their desserts and I don't think we may come back but it was worth a try. 

Hmm maybe we ordered the wrong items? If you have a late night sweet-tooth sure, this place doesn't close until midnight.
author: Victor Q.

description:
There's a wide variety of HK snacks, desserts, and drinks including "healthy" drinks.  I was fixated on the Bread Box, but being weaksauce, I downsized to the mini version, which is just a thick slice of toast with the same toppings.   The mini Oreo Bread "Box" was as good as it looks to satisfy my sweet tooth - warm and crunchy (perhaps too crispy) toast with Oreo and ice cream goodness, although the fruit was just ok.

Service was a bit slow even for a small place, which was half empty.  On the plus side, there are couches for more casual lounging instead of just tables.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I have to up my rating, I'm here *way* too often not to, mostly to take advantage of the Honey Toast, "Golden Sesame Balls", and sticky rice with mango... Mmmm...

I do think it still needs a little bit of polish, but once that happens this will definitely be my favorite go-to hang out in the area.
author: Emilynne A.

description:
I should have read the reviews before stepping in to the place last night. We friends were looking for a quick dessert cafe on our way to home, when we came across this sign board of ETC Dessert Cafe. Well, without a much thought give, we decided to give it a shot and continue with our night. What I noticed - 

The service was terrible, ultra slow. 
The menu was quite impressive in terms of quick bites 
Staff was not at all trained for hygiene 
They charge extra if you pay on your card. 

Except for point two, none of them made any sense to me. So I'm never going back to this place to have anymore desserts. Phewww!!
author: Dinkar K.

description: I came with a few friends to get dessert and the fours of us shared two honey breads. We waited probably about 20 minutes for it to be made. It was good, pretty much like every other place that sells brick bread.
author: Sandy N.

description: It's lit fam. Everything is bomb. Y'all should come and try it here. The food is amazing! And they have good customer service! Good place for hangouts!
author: Steph A.

description: The place is small, didnt have to wait in line. The food came our fast and the girls there like to show off their legs... (it was a ok summer night). Everything there is overly sweet but the presentations are nice. The server that night was attentive at filling up my water cup but when it comes to her table bussing skills.... all I have to say was she almost dropped all the plates to the floor. Inexpensive and good for 2-4 people parties. It will be hard to accommodate parties with more than 4 people. The restroom is located in the building next door and the key to the restroom is right at the door.
author: Jan H.

description:
When I found this cafe, there were many blue  christmas lights at the front. You can't really miss it! When we entered there was only one waitress. She gave us menus and we all asked for water. 10 min in our water finally came... but she didn't get enough for everyone. So we just assumed she would come back with more.... but she didn't. 20 minutes later she finally got our orders. I had the dessert sampler, and my sister had the mixed fruit w/mango juice. 20-30 minutes later our orders finally came... which felt really long. My sister enjoyed her dessert, except her pineapple wasn't fresh. She said it was old. The dessert sampler was pretty good, my favorite would have to be the creme brulee and the mocha ice cream w/cake. Once we were finished we had a hard time getting the waitress to give our checks. We waited another 15 minutes or so again. 

Overall the desserts were pretty good, excluding the pineapples. The creme brulee is definitely my new favorite dessert. Nonetheless service was incredibly slow, one waitress shouldn't handle the whole cafe. I left with mix feelings about this place so thats why I'm giving 3 stars.
author: Doris L.

description: If you want honey toast, this place is definitely a go to. I am not an expert, but I do like that the honey toast here is better than other places I have tried, like 5 Degrees and I dare to say Honey Berry and Akihabara. It does take time because they cut out the bread, butter it up, toast and reassemble the inside back into the crispy toast shell part. It takes like 10-25 minutes depending on how busy they are, but definitely won't be a problem if you bring friends. If you are stuffed from your dinner and you come here, your stomach will be ready by the time the honey toast gets to your table. They have a nice selection of honey toast. The ice cream doesn't melt right away , which is a plus. The bread is super crunchy and the butteriness isn't too overwhelming.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
I wanted to like this place, but the dessert was not up to par compared to the other Chinese dessert places.  

I ordered a fungus soup with papaya and it was not really sweet.  My friend ordered the black sesame paste and it was watery - it should be thicker.  Also, we ordered the waffle which we thought would be like a eaglets to share, but it was actually 2 waffle with condensed milk.  Unfortunately, the waffle were soft - prefer to be crispy.

It was a total failure and I wonder why it was empty on a Saturday night.  I mean, if you going to have a Chinese dessert place, make your desserts at least decent.  Big failure.  

One good thing was they asked what they can improve on, my friend told them.  I don't think we will be back.  Nice place but it was not worth it unless they make a big improvement.
author: James L.

description:
Don't usually go into dessert cafés, but some friends and I had just left a concert, exhausted and thirsty. Since it was one of the only cafés open near my apartment, we stopped in only for a drink, only to be enticed by the menu. I ended up ordering french fries and an Oreo shake. The atmosphere was quite chill and forgive my ignorance of not being able to recognize languages, the Cantonese(?) music was really cool. Being that we came in late, I felt pretty bad because there was only one employee working. However, she was so cute and friendly! 

When I received my oreo shake, I was so surprised, it was pretty good! The fries were perfectly fried too. 

Cute place! I'd come back again.
author: K N.

description: Very cute place and their creme brulee is really good! They give free dessert when you check in which is a plus!
author: Scott Y.

description: First time coming here. Dessert was okay. Service was friendly and it was a chill place to hang out.
author: Anita L.

description: I have to admit, it is small, and sometimes slow, but they make the best damn nutella waffles with marshmellows on the whole block, even from their competitor next door whom always seem to have lots of customers. Honestly, just because they have lots of people means nothing. ETC Dessert are attentive and always have some chinese films on! Get the nutella waffles with marshmellows! AMAZING
author: Sandra D.

description: Ever have a bland bowl of ramen that just has absolutely  no taste? Well guess what this place? This place just won the award for the most disgusting bowl of ramen with no taste  at all. Seriously peeps you can't  just messed up a bowl of ramen :(
author: Lu Lu L.

description: My friend and I were searching for a place that served honey toast. We came across this place and decided to try it out. Inside it is decorated super cute! The service was great! And the strawberry sweetheart honey toast was amazing!
author: Ashleigh R.

description: Dude it wz hella good food. My squirrelfriend squad came here for a girls night out. We got a regular size tiramisu honey toast and it wz fuego. I will definitely be coming here many more times in the future and tryig out more of their food as well
author: Kanika G.

description: This place has the best creme brûlée ever good price for the portion size. Also this place is one of the few places that serve sharks fin soup. HELLO!
author: Gio D.

description:
Since I was sick, I thought it might be nice to have something warm & sweet to coat my sore throat.

I got a Stewed snow frog with papaya to-go which cost close to $8 but only filled up half of the tiny container (see the picture).  It was super sweet & some of the snow frog tasted really fishy because there was still some blood left behind.

The service was slow but it was good.  There wasn't anyone else in the store but it could be because it was very new.  I was really excited to check this place out since there aren't any Chinese dessert places nearby.  But I think I will wait to decide whether or not to go again until there are more reviews.
author: Karen S.

description:
Service was amazing! The waitresses were friendly, accommodating, and understood what I requested. The ambiance could be better. I love the lights at the front door (looks like a lounge haha) but inside was bland and simple. 

I had pasta carbonara and takoyaki for the meal. They were both mediocre. I wasn't expecting some bomb-ass dish anyway. I just need some tummy filling food. Then I moved on to my mini-Tropical Delight Honey Toast. I regretted ordering it mini. It was so delicious. The toast just melted it my mouth. The cantaloupe flavor ice cream went perfectly with all the fruits and condensed milk haha. 

One downside will be that they do take time to prepare each plates. But then, that's fine because I was there to spend some quality time, enjoying the dessert, chatting etc. Was not in a hurry at all.

All in all...stop by and try the toast! The solution for your sweet tooth problems !
author: Tipsy T.

description:
Nice waitresses.

So this place is called ETC Dessert Cafe, so of course I get their pasta. Makes perfect sense, right? Although the chicken was cooked fine and the pasta was the perfect al dente, goopy clumpy sauce ruins a dish every time.

Also, the wifi wasn't working, so they told me to use someone else's. They just happened to also have the password on hand. Laughs were had, internet was stolen.
author: Ben T.

description:
had the waffle with chocolate and nutella i think it was pretty good. my freinds order some other stuff that they liked. i ordered a matcha green tea or somthing it was ok. me and my freind both order this mango drink that was good.

some of the desserts was ok and some were good. the presentation was very nice but they did take a while to make them look all good i guess. the place is kinda small, we got there and was able to get a table for 4 without wait. i also like the look of the place i guess i am a sucker for that but i would come here again
author: David M.

description: Extremely slow server seems confused. Awkward experience food was average nothing really special about it
author: Sherry F.

description:
Service: Good. We had to flag the girl down a few times to get more tea. 1 star

Dessert: Meh...it wasn't all that good. My taro coconut sago had no taste of taro or coconut. Tasted like watered down coconut with a load of sago. 

The place is quite small but we didn't get kicked out for staying an extra hour or two just chatting. Kudos to that. 1 star
author: Serena F.

description: Love the LA meets SF food. Small nice place. Service is slow then again it's handled by one waitress. I love the bread with fondue or even the brick toast. Fruit isn't fresh because it's served when not in season. Peaches were canned and honeydew tasted like pure water. Brick toast is #1.
author: Vic A.

description:
Customer service: Excellent and friendly people who work here!!!

Food quality:  Tummy satisfied LOL pretty delicious :)

The only downside is the waiting period for the food to be prepared but I believe in food quality rather than just eat and leave.  After all it is a dessert place which is meant for people to relax and chill... :) 

I will def be going and try it out again LOL
author: Joseph M.

description: Okay i haven't tried it here but that's because i've been trying for few times now! It says it's open from 6pm till late but our attempts failed because they are still close by 6:30! Tried again the orher day by around 7pm and it's still closed! Hopefully next time it will be open like they said it will be open!
author: Em S.

description:
OMG, this place is a stoner's heaven. It's open until the early morning and they sell the most amazing desserts ever. I like going here once in a while to splurge on something huge. It is pricey but totally worth the money. I like the ambiance of the place. It has a younger crowd that adds a nice feel to the place. 

For a while they had this really tacky set-up with cases displaying iPhone cases. I stopped going after this because it gave the place a different feel. Before this they had a really nice set-up with a couple of couches and a table between for people to sit, chill and chat but they took it out and put in this cabinet to sell cases but took it out because I don't think it was doing well. I just want to say they had a great thing going before I wish they would've  just left it they way it was. 

Other than that the food is awesome, I couldn't be happier with anything I get here.
author: Krishna V.

description:
After dinner one night my friends and I were walking around irving in hunt of a dessert place to satisfy our sweet tooth. We saw this place and decided to take a shot. It's a cute little shop with about 6 little tables, some sofas. The place is decorated with blue christmas lights and looks nice... too bad it was one of the biggest dessert disappointments I've had.

So we sit down and promptly get some hot tea. The waitress is really cheery and nice and it all pretty much went down here from there.

What we had:

Dessert sampler ($9.95) : it included:
watery creme brulee with a very stiff sugar coating, soft mango pudding with some cream? on top, didn't taste like mango; a bite of tiramisu that was half forzen, 1 strawberry chopped up, 2 mandarin orange wedges, one wedge of kiwi, 2 balls of watermlon and 1 of honey dew, plus two tiny spoons of ice cream that was beginning to get gritty because it was old

Waffle: 4.95: it was a cold waffle (semi stiff like it had been cooked a few days ago) The size was that of half a round waffle, with a scoop of ice cream, a few pieces of fruit, a little drizzle of watered down chocolate and some whipped cream.

This place is basically about false presentations. Everything attemps to look 'cute', but nothing actually tastes good or has much value. What makes matters worse is that it took 30 minutes at least to get everything and the anticipation didn't make anything taste better!
author: Christine B.

description: Good place after dinner. Decent dessert and  service. 4 stars because the restroom is quite scary :D
author: Son N.

description:
I usually just go to Golden Island when i'm craving chinese desserts. But I just had San Tung, and I was on Irving might as well... 

The desserts are MAD expensive, for such a small portion. The service sucks, it's just girls who try to remember what we ordered and kept coming back to ask... Small place too. 

Not coming back. As far as desserts, it's too sweet.
author: Crystal C.

description: Doesn't have as expansive a chinese dessert menu as say Golden Island, but you can find some stuff like the sesame rice balls in ginger soup. This time I had the honey toast - this stuff is way better than at Akiba's, but too much for one. The crust was very crispy and buttered even on the inside, and the cubed up insides were also toasted. Their "minis" are still friggin large! They also have a checkin offer for another free small dessert if you spend $20+ right now.
author: Linus W.

description:
Third time here & still excellent service! Love the brick toasts, snacks, & sampler!! Environment/atmosphere is very cute and bright! Everything is very customizable & looks true to pictures on their menu!

This is the only other place I am always happy to go to besides Sweet Cafe for late night Asian desserts! I highly recommend their honey toasts and if you have more than one person, their regular size is just perfect! On your own? Try a mini if you're not too hungry!

Their snacks are pretty good too. The first time I came here I was actually looking for a cozy place for desserts&snacks. I tried their "imitation sharkfin soup" and it wasn't too shabby! Their creme brulee is also delicious! After the first time, full off a few snacks, I decided I would love to come back for some of their brick toasts & it did not dissapoint! :)
author: Carin S.

description:
Can't decide between 3.5 or 4, so I just gave it 4 stars.  The first few times I came here, I thought the tirumisu toast was delicious.  Not sure if it was because we ordered the mini toast, but this past time, we ordered the regular size and it wasn't the same.  We also order the mixed fruits with jelly, which was a little too sweet for my taste.  It was drowned with condense milk. 

Service is usually good.  The server is very sweet, but there's only one person working, so service may be slow when there's a rush.  I also deducted one star because they don't have a restroom there, so you have to go next door, up the stairs to some building.
author: Melissa T.

description:
HONEY TOAST! Yummmmmm. 
I came here with a few friends after a concert in Golden Gate Park, and we tried three different desserts. But the honey toast is the only thing worth coming back for.

It's basically a super thick piece of bread that's carved out. They fill it with toasted cubes of the bread, fruits, ice cream and whipped cream! The bread is toasted with butter and honey, which complements the ice cream really well. The dessert is sweet without being overly sweet, and easy to share with a group of friends.

We also tried the waffle with icecream & fruit, which was very standard, and black sticky rice, which ended up being really soupy and kind of strange.

The shop is pretty clean, and the waitress is really nice. Definitely would come back for more honey toast!
author: Stephanie W.

description: The only reason why i will have SoCal withdrawls is because of the food in SoCal.  One main dish that i miss is the Brick toast.  I've had other brick toast in SF but this place has the best selection.  There's matcha green tea, tiramisu, a fruity one, and an oreo one, i'm sure they have more but i  don't remember.  You can also get a mini toast if you can't finish it with your friends.  My favorite is the Matcha green tea one, because it's not as sweet as the tiramisu one. Chocolate lovers should get the Tiramisu one. Their bread is is more buttery compared to other places and it's so more crunchy too.  They have other types of toast here, and the employee told me that the those toast are prepared differently and they use different breads.  I have yet to try their other desserts here. I've had the Nutella mashmellow waffle and it was really good esp when it's warm.  The place is pretty cozy, and they have a tv that shows you K-pop music and other Chinese music.  I think this place might be topping my fav. place to get brick toast!
author: Belinda C.

description:
ETC is just the perfect name for this tiny dessert joint on Irving. They have a great selection on all things desserts from honey toast boxes, sago, ice cream, waffle ice cream sandwiches, and ETC! any given day, I'd hate to trek my way to Irving but at night, thank goodness the streets are all clear and parking is a breeze! 

Its not hard to find ETC as there are lights flashing on the outside to welcome you in.
Luckily there was no wait around 9pm and we immediately found a seat. But damn those honey toast boxes for taking so long. We were still waiting for a friend to arrive and it just so happens that a group of 10 each decides to order their own honey toast box. Do you know how long it takes to make one? About 10-15 minutes. *shakes my fist in the air* 

Even with the wait ahead of us for food, my friends and I shared a honey toast box with strawberries and ice cream, and an order of chicken wings! We didn't realize how hungry we'd be and finished in no time when it finally arrived. The honey toast is tastier here than Akiba. It has more of a crunch while still soaking in the ice cream. The chicken wings are delicious too. Nice batter and flavorful! 

I definitely plan to come back in the future and hopefully they can surprise me with more desserts, oh say I don't know, crepes, bread pudding, gelato, brownie ice cream sandwiches, etc etc etc!
author: Connie C.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite places so far from my visits to SF. 

Went there to get food and brick toast. The lady working was super helpful and friendly. She seated us with menus, asked if we wanted water or tea, brought tea and took our orders. She kept in mind to ask us things to get us more comfortable such as asking if we wanted our brick toast after the food or at the same time. She made sure to inform us that brick toast will take about 20 minutes or so before we ordered it (but it came faster). While we were waiting for the food, she saw that we had our phones out and was thoughtful to come by and tell us the wifi password. NEVER had that happen before and LOVED that she did that. +1 right there.

The overall atmosphere of the place is like a small cafe shop with a tv in the middle playing Korean music videos and Korean songs in the background. 

The food was good too! We ordered the Strawberry ______  brick toast. So everything went well here but what really brought it up to 5-stars was the service.

Will definitely come back!
author: Jasmine C.

description:
A great little place that is super cozy!
The desserts are good and the people who work there are nice.
The best part is it's not too busy so we never have to wait to get a seat.

P.S. they accept Square! Way to support new tech! :D
author: Clement N.

description:
I first learned of this place back in August 2012. Late, I know. ETC is awesome in a lot of ways and I think I've been here possibly once every 3 weeks since my cherry was popped.

So why 4 stars? Although Eva is extremely nice, sometimes I don't feel as if staff are completely attentive. That's about half a star because I really need my water refilled instead of staring at an empty glass. I also haven't really had their signature toasts so I can't honestly say they're completely amazing in my dessert book.

My favorites:
For appetizers, I really like their Curry Fish Balls. They're the right kind of spicy and definitely wake up your taste buds. For an entree, their special pastas are a nice-sized portion for the price but I like the creamy mushroom pasta with chicken the most. Hands down, I LOVE the Mango Macau Pudding. I don't know what it is about it but it's just so satisfying.

Anyway, I'd highly recommend anyone whose looking for a dessert place to visit ETC at least once. Everyone usually goes for their signature toasts but they have a good selection for every appetite.
author: Angel C.

description: We got the green tea and red bean shaved ice with green tea ice cream. It was pretty good! The ladies who work there are super friendly :)
author: Lincy H.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday night and it wasn't that crowded. There was a parking spot right outside.

We ordered a honey green tea, the fin soup, and the soft tofu flower with the mango and sago. They didn't give us hot tea. Was I supposed to ask for it? Anyway, the honey green tea taste great. The fin soup is pretty good, but I wished there was more "fin" in the soup. The mangos and the mango juice that came with the soft tofu flower was from a can. I was particually disappointed because pretty much all Asian dessert places use real mangos.

ETC isn't all that special. Just a normal Asian dessert place. Maybe I'll come back and try their toast, since they did look good but we were too full to eat that.
author: Jay L.

description: Dinner is nice with drink! Food is not bad, and good place to spend a night with friends. Check in with yelp can get free desert when spending $20+
author: Randolph T.

description:
Not my first choice for Chinese desserts in the Sunset, but I'd return.  

Open late, nice chill crowd (some come to watch Chinese soap operas, chat, and have sweets), standard snacks.
author: Mandy H.

description:
I LOVE adventurous food and this place served it up right away! Everything was funky and super Asian - my friend who'd spent abroad in China was freaking out about how authentic the experience was. 

The gal that served us was very interested in us having the best experience, telling us how to eat the dessert we got, recommending others for next time, and generally very much trying to make sure we had a good time.

We got the chocolate macaroon toast party and just the name alone made it worth it, but it was delicious and different and I can't wait to try more. Their presentation is fantastic! Super beautiful!
author: Kristin H.

description: Was looking for a Honeyberry store but found out it had closed. Luckily, found this place and the reviews seemed good. Kind of a small place. Needs a better menu board. I had already been looking through pics to see what looked good. Waitress handed me a menu and another card that had pictures of various desserts. Didn't  seem to have all the different kinds of dessert though. So I just pointed to one in the Yelp pics. Asked if I wanted the regular size (brick) or mini. The regular size looked like too much (I had just eaten dinner) so I chose a mini Tiramisu Coffee Toast. The toast was about 1.5 inches high and the inside was cut to separate from crust and cubed. Topped with coffee ice cream, cookie, tiramisu cake and some strawberries. Tasted similar to a toast dessert had at Honeyberry. It was really good. I'll have to try some of the other selections next time.
author: Ronald C.

description: 2nd time Coming here on a Saturday night at 11pm. Strawberry sweetheart toast too sweet and the service is terrible. They never check up on you, you have to raise your hand if you need napkins or water etc haha
author: Kathleen P.

description:
I came here on a mission to try HK style french toast.

They didn't have it on the menu but the female employee ordered the closest thing they could conjure. What I received was deep fried bread with peanut butter inside, a square of butter on top, and syrup on the side. It wasn't soaked in egg, but it was still fun to eat. I was even able to get some condensed milk instead of syrup. Really great service.
author: Rahil P.

description: very delicious and nice store！I really lo ve the jasmie green tea and complimentry tiramisu！
author: Le A.

description:
So my mom and I were looking for a dessert shop. This place had ok rating and we never been so I thought we would give it a whirl. Did not have great expectation. 

The decor was too cute kinda kiddish. The service was very nice. Our server was very attentive but didn't hover. Reading the reviews seems honey toast was their specialty and the waitress confirmed. We ordered the tirimisu honey toast and sesame glutinous balls. The sesame balls came out first and they were good. Not a big fan of the syrup but the balls were good. Better than the frozen one from the store.  We had WTO wait a while for the toast
author: Sharon C.

description: We always get boba from the place next door and grab pho @ Kevin's so we decided to try this place out for dessert. Overpriced desserts, small portions, but the reason for 2 stars is the desserts just didn't taste very good. We ordered the fruit salad sago and it tasted pretty watery....Definitely does not satisfy the Canto dessert craving.
author: Betty C.

description: Quaint little Asian dessert cafe in Outer Sunset with K-pop videos playing on the TV...always a good sign.  We ordered the Creme Brulee, Mini Honey Toast with Matcha & Red Bean and Ginger Milk Pudding.  The former was decent and I enjoyed the mix of flavors in the toast without any one component being overly sweet.  Service here is attentive and friendly so overall, not a bad spot to satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: Eric F.

description:
I was rather surprised that I never noticed this place. The desserts are alright. I have an insane sweet tooth so I love getting desserts. The menu doesn't have a large variety to choose from and some combinations are odd and excess. I had the mixed fruit pudding and a creme brulee with my friend. The desserts were average and overly sweet, I'm rather disappointed for such a cute looking dessert house, the food didn't meet my expectations. 
I won't be coming back.
author: Veronica L.

description:
New place in sunset. 

        I love to go around place to place to find good foods and nice places. 

This is place is great. cause I love to go out at nite. This place open til 2am.

There milk tea is good.  And they have a very very relax sofa let you sit and talk

that will make me give them 5 star.  Cool place to hang up .
author: Erica T.

description: Water cups smell like old dirty towel.
author: Anna T.

description:
The honey toast is good here. It's BIG so SHARE. :)
They have a good selection of items. Both times I came here I ordered the honey toast to share, but look forward to trying other specials. 

Nice decor, and friendly staff. 
Food service is a bit slow when this place has a lot of customers. But this would be a good place to just chill with your friends. They open pretty late so that's a plus.
author: Erica L.

description:
10pm on a Saturday night and there was a 6 person table available for us... kinda weird.

All I can remember is that the wait for the dessert was unbearably long. If I hadn't come with a group, I'd have been bored out of my mind. Each dessert came out at different times too with long lag times in between.

Fresh from trying Akiba's honey bread box/brick toast, I had to try the one here too. Sadly, I don't think it compares as ETC makes their's extra toasted; it's hard to eat without scratching up the roof of my mouth. My friend had the $5 Banana Berry waffle and she liked it for the price. 

Not a bad place but I see myself going over to iCrave for their waffles more. Also, to use their bathroom, you have to get a key and go out of the store and down this alley way next door. Um.... no thanks. Cash only.
author: Liana L.

description:
After dinner, friends and I decided to grab some Chinese dessert. 

We ordered one of the waffles. The waiter was nice. We ended up ordering a waffle thing with ice cream and fruits on it. The waffle was warm to the touch. 

Overall it was good :] But parking is eh since it IS irving. Lots of kids come here too.
author: Harmony C.

description:
A decent, not amazing / not awful dessert spot in San Francisco.  We ordered 5 desserts, a couple were good, one was great (the smores waffle) and two were awful.  The green tea waffle and tarot pudding type thing were good.

The red bean tofu soup tasted like dirt.  Literally.

The hot milk tea (caramel) was AMAZING.  The staff was sweet.  The prices are reasonable and you get deals for checking in on yelp.
author: Melanie K.

description:
I'm never disappointed every single time I come here. This is my go-to dessert place!
