Honey toast: BEAUTIFULLY PUT TOGETHER. I wouldn't go anywhere else for it. There are a lot of different varieties to choose from, but my favorite is the strawberry one. The only set back is that it takes 10-15 minutes to make it.

Chocolate fondue: Great to share and it is great as a light dessert with fruits, honey toast bits, and marshmallows. 

The service is outstanding because the waitress comes to check up on you once in a while and refills your water promptly all the time.

I love the overall ambiance of the little place. They recently bought nicer chairs so it's a nice place to sit and talk with friends.
author: Terri H.

description:
Came here on a Friday night around 8:30-9 p.m. and it was packed. After eating a large dinner at Tonight we wanted to grab some dessert. We had a friend who came up from SoCal for spring break who was craving the honey toast from this place.  We were debating on whether or not to go in because we were a party of 6 and there wasn't enough space for all of us. We walked in a the waitress was quick to tell us that she would make a table available for us in a minute. The service is pretty good here being that there was only one girl running the whole show. The selection for desserts at this place is pretty good, but to be honest we always order the same things. Honey brick toast and matcha and red bean shaved ice bowl. 

The only downside is waiting 10-15 minutes for the brick toast.
author: Nicole L.

description: Came here with a couple of my close friends to eat dessert and I ordered the Tiramisu thing. It was pretty good, I liked it. But I didn't like how their bread was really hard. I have sensitive teeth and I couldn't handle the super hard bread. Overall, it was okay. The service was great, but the food was alright.
author: cadence p.

description:
As a huge fan of dessert, how can I give a super low rating to this place? It's a little small, so on busy nights this place gets a little crowded..

I've only tried their pyramid toast with vanilla ice cream. I'm not sure if we ordered the wrong thing or if the waitress misheard us, but we were highly disappointed with how we expected it to look (seeing the pictures on the menu) and how it really looked. The proportions were so small!!

I also really was not a fan of how the toast was already cut up for us, but the taste was pretty good! The only reason why I knocked it down a star was because our order was forgotten. We sat there for a good 30 minutes until we realized everyone else was getting their desserts before we were. 

Will I be coming back? Most likely! It's a good place to hang out with friends and get some dessert... Also, parking is not too hard to find at night, but can get a little annoying around dinner time and on the weekends around 3-8pm. Just go up the block and park in the residential areas.
author: Gelene V.

description:
Saw a new dessert place and thought I'd give it a try. There were people there but not crowded or anything. It's pretty tiny inside so if they did get crowded, I can only imagine the wait time. The blue lights are interesting but they're a bit too bright and can become an eyesore after a while. Unfortunately, we were seated right under the TV and it was extremely loud. All the other customers were watching it but our table hated it since it was so loud. Would be better if they placed the TV not directly over a table or lower the volume.

As for the food... I got the pancake with the assorted fruits and ice cream. It was alright, the pancake was light and fluffy. Sad thing was that it took forever to make. I think I waited almost 25-30 minutes just for my pancake. Everyone else in my group finished theirs. Weird thing was that not everything came together, everything item came on its own with 5-10 minute gaps in between. Some of them wanted to wait but we didn't want their ice or ice cream stuff to melt so we told them to start first... they ended up finishing and not just starting!

My friend got a dark chocolate fondue... she said she wasn't too impressed. They literally stuck a candle (which was pretty weak) to keep the chocolate hot. However, the flame was weak and the chocolate wasn't fully melted... so it took a while before she could start dipping. Either they need to get a better candle or lower the bowl containing the chocolate into the fire more so it melts better.

My other friend got a mango shaved ice... I tried it. It was okay, but definitely not worth a 15-20 minute wait for it. Pretty big portion though compared to other dessert places.

Overall, the desserts were alright. Service was... okay. They kept coming by and apologizing and refilling our tea cups though. But with 3 workers and not much costumers to serve... I expected the food to come out faster.
author: Johnson S.

description:
My friend and I set out on Irving to look for a place to eat dessert. We wanted a place that had some savory snacks to fill his stomach as well as something sweet for me to eat. We saw the menu here as we walked by and decided to try it out.

The menu has a huge amount of choices for both savory and sweet cravings. I took at least 5 minutes to sort through my options on the menu (I tend to do this often). My friend ordered the rice noodle roll, which he says was not hot when it came out, but warm enough. Minus one star for that. I ordered the coconut and grass jelly shaved ice, which was delicious and devoured pretty much the whole thing...The portion would be better for two people to share.

I played on my friend's iPad while eating and, just our luck, the waitress spilled one of our cups of tea and almost killed the iPad! No stars taken off for that though--that'll teach us to play on an iPad while eating out...

The shop is cozy and comfortable and I really liked it on a quiet Sunday night. I'd go again.
author: Reanna T.

description: I really enjoy this place. Cute decor and waitresses always have a smile on~ My friends and I always order a pyramid toast or two (maccha personal favorite) and honey mix fruit drink HOT. These never disappoint and they satisfy that craving for a sweet dessert~
author: Nick Z.

description:
First time coming here last week and I liked it overall. The place isn't that big but the waitress was super nice and friendly! She really described things well if we had any questions or if we didn't know what something was on the menu. 

My friend and I got the Thick Brick Toast but mini versions. I'm glad this place has a mini option. Anyway, I got the Tropical Thick Toast and it was pretty good overall. The pieces of bread weren't too buttered like at Akiba (well my experience at Akiba, anyway), which I really liked. The only thing that I didn't like was that the crust was a little hard but everything else was fine! I think I'd definitely come back here to try more of their items :) It's also conveniently located near me so that's another plus!
author: Kathleen A.

description:
Not entirely busy on a Saturday night. Service is a bit slow and our waiter was not too proficient in English. I had the peach shaved ice. It's nothing amazing but definitely not bad for $3.95 although the cantaloupes weren't sweet and it really brought down the quality for me. My friend got the oreo milkshake which would be exactly what you'd expect. The black currant juice is a little tart for my liking but it's nice, it channels a lemonade kick. We also got the strawberry and ice cream waffle which was good and it came with sprinkles, haha. Be aware that the food comes out slowly - our waffle came out like fifteen minutes later than the red bean soup which I think is rather problematic. 

The place is new so I don't really know what's good here but the food was alright and the price is cheap.
author: Ryan L.

description: The decorations are interesting. The food is alright, it's good but nothing special. I had the Nutella waffle with marshmallow, I liked it cause it reminded me of s'mores. Not exactly sure what my friend ordered. It was like dessert tofu with mango syrup but he said it was more like mango pudding. My other friends ordered smoothies, they said the drinks were good but then again nothing really special.
author: Charlene P.

description: I have been very excited to try this place out. I was finally in the area and decided to go. Unfortunately they were Not open at 6:38pm on Tuesday 12/17/13. No hours posted, no hours on the menu, and no website. Yelp showed they were scheduled to be open. Oh well maybe another time ETC.
author: David B.

description:
Ordered the wrong dessert. Was expecting Mango Pudding HK style. But the Macau one is way different. Served in a Martini Glass, it has nice presentation but impractical because of the cocoa powder getting everywhere when trying to eat it. The Cookie-like layers inside was difficult to swallow. Really sweet and you need a glass of milk to go with it. 

Next time, ordering a drink instead. Service was Excellent. Staff was attentive and the boss lady is nice to talk to.
author: Dustin T.

description: Whenever I'm craving for some brick toast, this is always the place that pops in my mind. Love the Tiramisu one, so rich and creamy. I prefer that over the Macaron one anyday. I've also tried some shaved ice which is pretty decent. Make sure you order right away, it takes about 15-20min for them to make the Brick toast!
author: Alice K.

description:
Went here with my homegirl Tiff after we ate at San Tungs. Never heard of this place before but we just yelped something close by to try out for some hot milk tea. 

People inside were mostly enjoying deserts. We both ordered hot almond milk tea with less sweetner or "sugar". It took about 5-10min before we got our tea as she was bringing out the orders for the rest of the customers.

Overall, the milk tea was pleasant and ok. Seemed a little pricey at 8 bucks for both of ours with a not so large cup. I prolly would go back if i was in the area but i would not go out of my way to get a drink here.
author: Andrew S.

description:
3 stars for the food + 0.5 for the service!

This little dessert shop has potential to do really well! Items on the menu mimic those in Asia, but I feel like it almost tries too hard to include EVERYTHING. Yeah, it'd be great if this place could master every item on its menu, but it's definitely lacking in some areas in flavor, texture, and taste. I think it would be better for them to cut down some items on their menu, and concentrate on making their desserts up to par with those in Hong Kong/Taiwan. By that time, I'm pretty sure it would attract more customers, especially in the Sunset. 

1. Brick Toast
First time I came here, I tried their famous brick toast - forget the  name of it, but it was the one with the most fruits. I liked the texture of the toast, but both my friend and I thought that it was a bit too sweet. However, they piled on the fruits, which made it semi better :) I would get the brick toast again, but maybe in another flavor next time. The presentation looked nice also :)

2. Tofu Pudding
Second time I came here, I was craving tofu pudding. The texture of the tofu pudding was not quite there... kind of powdery and dense, definitely not silky smooth like it's supposed to :( But the waitress (owner??) was really nice and gave me extra syrup when I wanted it to be more sweet.

Would come back for dessert because it's a nice environment in their (not dirt, pretty spacious, not too loud), but I hope their desserts improve!!
author: Michelle L.

description: Nicely done, and hit the spot.  If you're in the area, it's worth popping in.  The waffles are made on-the-spot, not pre-made, which is the norm for this area.  Ice cream is typical, nothing special.
author: Diane M.

description: Pros-Open Late and Tiramisu honey toast, Waffes, Service, Desserts completely unique.                                                                       Cons- Macroon Choclate Cake.....ughh Only 1 macaroon? , 30 Cents Debt Charage, Just a tad too cheap, Menus are absolutely Rubish.     ~I will come here again when im craving dessert late at night, Next time I will try the food items to see if it earns that extra one star.....I Will come again :)
author: Danny F.

description: Really nice place. I come here once every two week or so. Takoyaki and Mango juice with Aloe combo is quite the best.
author: Jason X.

description: 10/10 would recommend strawberry toast is very yum service, great. food, awesome. location, good. Store, v v cute. Everyone come here for good desser and destress from life
author: Trishel C.

description:
Some Chinese ladies run this dessert place. This place is little cozy, but it is a good place to hang out with friends at night for dessert and chill chat. They have many different desserts on their menu and some of them are self-created by them. The price is fair compared with other dessert places. I have only been here for a couple times and I always have some good time. Their "Macaron Chocolate Party" and "Mixed fruit Mango Pudding" are good. 

My favorite drink is the "Mango Smoothie", which is my personal recommendation. I really love it!!! 

When I revisit next time, I will try the "Marshmallow Waffle with Nutella", which looks nice in the menu. 

Last, the dessert place stays open till very late, so you can always drop by at late night after dinner for a nice dessert.
author: S C.

description:
Mini Green Tea Red Bean Honey Toast is so good! The "mini" size is plenty enough to feed 2-3 people. I can't imagine how big the regular size is! The inside of the toast is cut up into cubes and every side is lightly toasted along with the outer crust and then reassembled back into box form. They drizzle on some honey and add the toppings: whipped cream; a scoop of green tea ice cream; a generous spoonful of red bean paste; some mochi and a small strawberry cut in half to garnish. The red bean paste tastes like it's made in-house; it isn't too sweet and I love the texture (they don't puree it to crap; it's chunky and delicious)! 

Note that it'll take ~15 minutes for your honey toast to come out. There is a disclaimer written on the menu, so be patient! 

Also, really attentive service! The young lady that helped us was so sweet and genuine. She checked up on us, refilled water, and even told us about the $0.30 charge if you decide to use your card there. 

Lighting can be a little dim, so instagram photos may not be as cute and fabulous as they should turn out. This place spends lots of time meticulously assembling their honey toasts!
author: Rebecca N.

description:
Came here during the crazy weekend of Outside Lands on a Saturday night around 10 with 3 other friends. We chose to sit on the couch because we're cool kids. The young lady who served us was super nice- I had just gotten my wisdom teeth out so I asked for some salt and she immediately offered some hot water to go with it ^_^. She was also very patient, explaining each menu item that we had a question about. We ordered the Chocolate Honey Toast (I think that's what it was called?)  & the Waffle.. with ice cream all over it. (see pics, haha). The ice cream was whatever ice cream and the whole dish was just super sweet. It was topped with sprinkles and basically covered in sugar. The waffle wasn't crunchy or anything but you could tell that they made their own batter for it. The macaron was also very sweet. And the restroom to this place ... it's in the building next door. I didn't even go in because I was so scared haha. But during the daytime, I'm sure it's fine :)
Oh, and my friend ordered the "traffic light" drink which tasted like asian gummies :( so sweet!
author: Chantel Y.

description: Delicious thick honey toast. :) Order it and split it with a friend! Best shared, as it is quite large!
author: Jasmine O.

description: Really nice service! The lady who worked there explained to my group what was in the desserts we were interested in. Btw if you check in and your order is more than $20 you get a free banana split or a marshmallow waffle.
author: Amy J.

description: This place is cheap and fun as a place to get desert and even a meal.  The location is a little tough to get to for most, though.  The Honey Toast is a personal favorite, but beware... it's huge!
author: Noah R.

description: I came to this cafe again the day after i came here for the first time. The toast is really awesome. The girl in the store is cute too. Highly recommend.
author: Kevin J.

description:
eh. it's asian. it has waffles. but I have definitely had a lot better elsewhere.

dessert sampler (creme brulee, maucau pudding (?-they ran out so they just gave us mango pudding), bite-size (literally a PINCH) of tiramisu cake, two babyspoonful of ice cream, and some random pieces of fruit (probably not fresh) saturated in chocolate sauce): $9.95 = MUST AVOID. worst dessert dish/sampler I've ever had. the tiramisu was a joke. it was the size of a froyo sample cup- the picture is very deceiving. it was also completely frozen. 

single waffle with ice cream and fruits=$4.25: better than the dessert sampler but that doesn't mean much. waffle was plain- crispy so i guess i would give this dish 3 stars. again, the picture is deceiving- it was half the size of what we imagined.

wait time: TOO long. 

staff: nice but a bit slow.

overall: will not recommend to others nor ever return. :(
author: Patricia K.

description:
One star for the look of the food. 

It used to be my favorite dessert place because of the decent pricing and quality of food, but my recent visits were very disappointing. 

Stepped in and asked for using the restroom, when I returned, the waitress gave my table to someone else. She came up to me and said 5 minutes, 10 minutes later she said 5 minutes. Finally got seated, but a dirty table with used napkins on top. Putting that aside, I didn't get served any tea until I asked for it. When I said I was ready to order she took the menu back to the front counter, came back and asked me what I wanted to order. I don't understand the meaning of doing that. 

Awful waitress who barely understands English. When I asked for no soy sauce on my food, she didn't understand.  When my food arrived, it was completely cold on the inside so I asked the waitress for a new plate. She replied  "you want it hot?" It's legit food, not dessert, isn't is suppose to be hot? She came back with the same plate, just microwaved. Awful tasting, bad customer, ruined my night.

Also while I was waiting, I've notice the waitress asking around tables by tables where the food on her hands belongs. 

Will not be back.
author: Jia C.

description: My friends and I came here for a late-night dessert run. Everyone enjoyed their desserts, which included 2 different types of sago and a mini tiramisu waffle. My boyfriend and I shared the dark chocolate fondue which was delicious, but to make it perfect they could have doubled or even tripled the quantity of chocolate given. The Asian music videos playing in the background were also very entertaining.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
I love dessert!! so when I found out we're going to try out a new dessert place I was the first one ran into the car and ready to go to ETC Dessert Cafe! 

Atmosphere of the cafe is so cute with their blue lights, couch, TV.  It's a cozy place, and great for friends gather, family events, or date! 
We tried their tiramisu brick toast, Hk style waffle, mixed fruit with grass jelly, and mixed fruit with sweet tofu.  They were all so yummy!! not overly sweet but sweet enough to warm my heart! My favorite one is tiramisu brick toast! toasts were crispy and buttery on the outside but soft and warm inside, it's perfect to eat it with ice cream!! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it right now! I'll definitely go back to this place again, again, and again!
author: Lisa C.

description: I been there last time and I think the food is very good. The Ice cream Toast is one of the best food I will recommend to everyone. Also, the dessert is very good as well. Just like we went back to Hong Kong and have dessert in the HK Dessert Cafe.
author: Angel L.

description: The service is poor because they always take forever to give me the menu after seating me and forever to order and forever to get my food and check. With such a small location, I don't understand why it's so difficult for them to pay attention to their customers. Plus side, they have free wifi, their desserts look super presentable and tastes not bad. I ordered chicken wings one time, and I only got 4 mini wings, which I feel like I got ripped off for. The mango sago with tofu fa was not flavorful, very bland. BUT I do like their Takoyaki. Probably wouldn't come back if I didn't have to.
author: Amanda C.

description: A great place to have dessert in outer sunset. Very friendly service! Food portion is huge. I could not even finish the mango sago because they gave me so much.
author: Quan D.

description: super charming, open late, great great service. yummy asian desserts that are made with care. tasty mango pudding and honey toast
author: Pip R.

description: The toast here is pretty good! It's light, so go for bigger portions. Other items were ok. Seating can be a little difficult on weekend evenings.
author: Thuan N.

description: small little cafe but with lots of good desserts. Their honey toast is better than other places I've been.
author: Mara G.

description: 5 Stars across the board! The desserts were really good. The smoothes were really good. And to my surprise, the service was EXTREMELY great! I found this place on Yelp after leaving a club early. I really wanted dessert and they seemed like the best choice that was still open at 12. Our waitress, who's name i wish i asked for, was awesome! She recommnended which desserts to get.... She kept making sure if everything was tasty (in a non-annoying manner)... and was just over all polite. Also, she wasnt super asian so she was easy to understand lol.
author: Craig S.

description: 5 Stars for the their honey thick toast. It's the toast that's phenomenally WONDERFUL!  But all other desserts still has room for improvements.  I've went there two times already, there toast is still great.
author: K G.

description: They are the best place for dessert and snacks at night in my opinion. I never liked going to dessert until i tried coming here because other places around Sunet and Richmond are very crapy. Their seats are also very comfortable and their restaurant is very bright
author: Aaron L.

description: The desserts here is not bad. I particularly like the taro sago (hot) here. It's yummy. Coming here at night , eating desserts with friends is such a treat. They really need to step up the cooking time. The wait is quite long for a simple dish.
author: Dee L.

description: First time here with friends and they have creative desserts! We had their ETC dessert sampler, shaved ice, fresh fruit sweet tofu fa cold! (my favorite) and their peanut butter french toast. Good dessert and good service.
author: Ella A.

description: It was nice that they were so close to the Academy of Science and open pretty late. It had a cute atmosphere and looked pretty new. Their desserts look gorgeous, but when it comes to taste, it's alright. We also ordered their snack combination which came with takoyaki, fried chicken wings, calamari  rings, french fries, and fried fish balls. But the plate was so sad! There were only 2 takoyaki balls and 3 chicken wings, the fries were either stale or overcooked and cold, but they sure gave us a lot of cheap fried fish balls...Their tea was the most watered down tea I've ever had and we overheard the waitress telling other customers to "stop going to that other place". If you wanna beat the competition, do it by offering quality food and service first.
author: Shelly U.

description:
food: 4/5
decor/atmosphere:5/5 (typical asian dessert place)
service: 3/5

I came to ETC dessert Cafe after dinner. My friends and I were all really full but decided we wanted sweets. We got the toast desserts. There are two sizes, mini and normal. There were 3 of us and we got two mini  with ice cream (total $15 including extra cost for ice cream on top of the toast) and it filled us up pretty well. I would say a mini size will serve 1-2 people. The average size 2-3 people. I would definitely come here again, the desserts were so pretty!!! It was too cute to eat. Each toast dessert comes with fruit, whipped cream, and small cookies on top. They arrange it soo well and is just a treat to look at. Although the presentation was great, I found the taste lacking. It was still good but nothing that wowed me.

The menu says toast dessert takes 10-15 minutes to make. So its not a quick stop. However, we waited almost 25 mins to get our food. I think they tried to make our dessert and the tables next to us together so they dont have to do as much work. I was a bit disappointed in the long wait time. Lastly, the bathrooms are outside the shop, and is a bit creepy. So try to use the loo before coming in.
author: Cecile S.

description: Where do I begin?  The first thing I noticed was the blue lights decorated in this place.  It was a bit distracting.  The menu is quite extensive for a small place like this.  The dessert took way too long to come out (15-20mins).  When I received my strawberry with mixed fruit sago, I was a bit disappointed because it was not good.  I had higher expectations for this place but it left me in great disappointment.  Furthermore, there was only one waitress working at night which can take awhile to flag her down for the bill.
author: Ann L.

description:
I came a few times and finally decide to write a review to share my exp. here
Very nice and cozy place. I'll always go for the sofa if I have a chance. I wasn't a big fan of dessert until one of my friends brought me here. 
I love their dessert trio.  You get to try a little portion of different things. My favorite is the pyramid toast. i can't believe I finished the whole thing by myself. One thing I have to have along with anything I tried here is a hot milk tea and the shark fin soup. Perfect the way I want it. 
My friend had a hot green tea latte And the tokayaki. She enjoyed it and wanted to order another one. Sometimes it gets a little busy but the servers were very friendly so I didn't mind a little bit of the wait.

Definitely will come back and try some of their other stuff on the menu.
author: Kit W.

description: Was here to try the Nutella marshmallow waffle and it was delicious.  Also ordered the Mixed fruit Grass Jelly with ice cream, that was okay.  Would definitely come back to try other selections.
author: C L.

description: Last Sunday I went to ETC at 3:30pm since that's time it opens, and it wasn't open. So today, Saturday, I went to ETC on time again at 3:00pm and we waited until 4 o'clock and it still wasn't open. The thing is, ETC doesn't put up their open hours schedule on the window of their restaurant, so we don't know if the schedule on yelp is correct too, and if afternoon isn't their opening hours, then I hope they correct the schedule so that we as customers don't waste our time.
author: Mandy L.

description: E.T.C is a good overall place for honey toast. They are known mostly for their toast and have a variety of dessert. Whether it be hot or cold, E.T.C is a good overall place to hang out with your friends.
author: Jason L.

description: When my friend and I came here , they didn't have mango pudding or Guilinggao . Their menu is pretty limited and their selection isn't that great so we just got the grass jelly w/ mixed fruits and the chocolate milkshake . The grass jelly w/ mixed fruits didn't taste good ... it lacked flavor . The mixed fruits didn't taste that great either . The chocolate milkshake was pretty good though . They're still fairly new so I'm sure they're still working on things . I'll return and re-evaluate on a later day .
author: Eileen L.

description: This place is awesome!! Its real tiny but the food is amazing especially the tiramisu and club sandwich. If your looking for a late night spot to hang out I recommend it
author: Andrew S.

description: get the green tea cake slice with red bean. full of green tea flavor, not too sweet, light and fluffy texture, red bean contrast. very nice. can order a whole cake w/ 2 days' advance notice for under $30; definitely worth it. but the cake pickup service & communication should improve.
author: V L.

description: Came here with my sister. She actually introduced this place to me. We tried the wings and fries combo and I got an order of takoyaki. The wings were tiny and were just ok. They were the perfect kind of wings to toss in buffalo sauce though. The fries were typical and they were pretty generous with it, so that was good. As far as the takoyaki goes, I've had plenty of different kinds of takoyaki, but this one was just ok. I thought the batter was too thick and dense. I probably wouldn't get it again. The star of our visit was the honey toast. YUM. We got the one with a bunch of fruits on it..I forget the name lol. It was soooo good. We got a mini size, and that was not mini at all, but it was perfect for my sis and I since we had food prior to the toast. If we got the regular size, we probably wouldn't have finished it. That was a good call on our waitress though because she actually recommended the smaller size lol. Service was excellent. The girl that was working when we came was such a sweetheart. She was so nice and polite and even asked how I liked the toast since it was my first time trying it. Service was a tad bit slow, but she was so nice that I didn't even really care. I would definitely come back for the honey toast, but the food...maybe not.
author: Faye M.

description: I think this might be one of my new favorite dessert places. The people working there are friendly and the drinks are delicious. I'm a fan of their fresh fruit honey green tea, which is a drink often found in Taiwanese places and rarely found in SF. They actually use fresh kiwis, mangoes, strawberries, and lemons! I also really like how they have couches there for customers to sit on, even though my friend K thinks they're really dirty :p.
author: Fiona N.

description: Never given a review on any food joint before, but had a good experience here at ETC last nite so I decided to create a account and give props. I had the munchies and decided to go to Irving to satisfy my sweet tooth. Saw this cool little trendy place with the kick ass Blue lights at the window. Nice comfortable spot with good seating and comfy looking lounge chairs. Place looked really clean and organized. Oh, and WIFI, gotta have WIFI. Really reminded me of my vaca in Tokyo where they had little gem food joints like ETC. I decided on the special they had advertised outside for waffles topped with bananas, strawberries, choco syrup and Ice cream. Seeing that, it was a done deal to satisfy my sweet tooth. The young ladies there were very friendly and also attractive, sorry had to throw that in there and asked me to take any seat. They serve hot tea while you wait, which I thought was really cool. While 1 of the girls was preparing my treat, the other came out with some appetizer which I did not order and she proceeded to say it was on the house as it was something that they were thinking about selling and I was gonna be the food taster. I had no problem with that of course, not sure exactly what you called it but it was rectangular wrapped crepe goodie with mango slices and whipped cream..soooo good. I told them it would be a hit and sell it. Next came the waffles, maaaan! it was screamin good! Waffles were perfect, not too crispy and hard and not soggy which I hate. The strawberries and bananas were fresh and sweet and the vannilla ice cream was thick and not air whipped. Good mix with the straw/ choco syrup. Never had this combo before on waffles and was impressed! It started to get pretty busy in the store and I saw all the desserts the ladies were rolling out and was like I gotta try those the next time I come. I told the young lady which turned out to be the owner, that she had a good thing going and to keep up the good food. I also told her the prices were good and reasonable compared to other places which I have gone too. She was very thankful and told her I will be coming here more often with friends to try out the other goodies on the menu.-Jeff
author: Mos J.

author: Jack L.

description:
I went here tonight with my single buddies because it was Valentine's Day and we wanted something sweet to end off the night. The cafe it VERY small, there was a max about 6 tables and one small couch area. So if you want intimacy, you got it here! We sat at the table closest to the window and they have these sparkling blue light flashing everywhere!  I feel like my friends and I got mini seizures while we where there. 

However, don't let the decor turn you off.  The serves was great...a little slow..but great. There was probably only one manager and a waiter there tonight to work the front but they were both really nice! When we had questions about the desserts they took the time to explain it to us and any other questions we had. Our orders took a while, i think partly due to the small staff size, but if you're with a group of friends just chilling and talking you really wouldn't mind it. We ordered the Banana Berry Brick Honey Toast (not on the direct menu), the matcha red bean waffles w/ green tea ice cream, and the Tiramisu Brick Honey Toast. I really liked how the toast inside and under the ice cream was not overly sweet and was cut into cubes, for easy eating, and individually buttered and toasted. The ice cream and topping are as expected and of good quality. The waffles had green tea powder in them and decent. The tiramisu was kinda grainy so we didn't really eat it but again the bread cubes and ice cream were yummy!  If i had to give this a grade for presentation i would give it an A+, when our orders came out they all looked really pretty and professional! Sad to admit we took a good 5 minutes taking an insane amount of pictures of just the food. 

Bottom line: I really like this place and had a very pleasant experience. If you want a nice cozy place to hang out at and you are not in a rush then definitely check this place out, just make sure you don't star too long at the flashing blue lights.
author: Danna L.
